loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 55 years old. Gloria is married and has six children. Her eldest is 34 and the youngest is 24. Gloria owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria sells fruits, vegetables and dried fish.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Lina de 35 años y sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven aprendió las técnicas para la construcción de viviendas; y en la actualidad se desempeña como obrero en diferentes trabajos, y lo contratan por temporadas. Le gusta mucho su labor pues obtiene ganancias que le permiten ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Él esta muy orgulloso pues su pareja lo ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ya que  trabaja como tejedora de bolsos y accesorios en una asociación de damas de su zona. Juntos buscan que trabajar a diario sin descuidar la educación de sus pequeños hijos. Como Pedro es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado terminar de construir su vivienda, e instalar un negocio en ese lugar, pues quiere dejar bien asegurado el futuro de sus hijos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Pedro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunas herramientas que necesita para su labor como obrero; además quiere ayudar a su pareja en la compra de materiales que necesita para seguir tejiendo, de esta manera espera continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Pedro is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse, 35, and their 3 children. Together they work every day to get ahead. When he was very young, he learned the techniques to build houses. At present, he works as a laborer at different jobs. He is hired seasonally. What he likes the most about his job is getting income which allows him to offer a good quality of life to his family. He is very proud and his spouse helps him with the household expenses. She works weaving bags and accessories in a women's association in the area. Together they look for work every day while still raising their small children. Since Pedro is an enterprising man he has planned for the future finishing his house and setting up a business there. He wants to insure the future of his children. This is the first loan that he has had with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to look bad to the people who made this money possible, which will allow him to continue working and seeking progress. Pedro plans on investing the loan he has applied for in purchasing some tools that he needs for his work as a laborer. In addition, he wants to help his spouse purchase materials she needs to keep weaving, and in this way she hopes to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase tools to continue his work as a laborer.

loans.name: Kyosimbaonanya Kikajjo-Kampala Group

texts.en: Maureen K. is 42 years old, has four children and leads a loan group called Kyosimbaonanya Kikajjo. For the last four years, she has made a living by running a small grocery store in the town of Namasuba. She started this business by investing a small amount of money she earned by farming, and today earns 100,000 shillings a month from the store and a small maize mill that she operates. Maureen has applied for this loan because she would like to expand her shop by buying more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell from a small store

loans.name: Dembe Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: Despite her single marital status, 50-year-old N. Margret has not wavered from principles she says have made her the respectable woman that she is. Being uncompromisingly diligent and standing strong in the face of financial adversity have been winning hallmarks in the execution of her fish sales business. She has been in business for the last five years, and her business is situated in Nasuti-Mukono. She earns 150,000 shillings in profits. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more fish for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Alhamdulilai Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Alhamdulilai II” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL to be shared equally among themselves. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Musa T. is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married to a businesswoman, and they have two children. Musa has been selling groundnuts for twenty years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy bags of groundnuts to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Elham

texts.ar:
الهام في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان زينة تحب عائلتها كثيرا وهي كل اهتمامها تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية 
بالاضافة الى حبها للخياطة الهام تعمل من اكثر من  12 سنة تريد تطوير نفسها وعملها وعائلتها من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة تريد شراء 
بضاعة جديدة للمحل شوكولا وغيره بمناسبة العيد لها مهارة عالية في عملها فهي متطورة وطموحا عملها مميز بالدقة والنشاط تحب ان تساعد عائلتها 
على تحسين وضعهم المادي فهي من يهتم بعائلتها واولادها
texts.en: Elham is a 38-year-old wife and mother of two who loves her family very much and wants to help them advance. For the past twelve years, she has been working at a convenience store and as a sewing professional to help provide for her family. Elham is very skilled in her work, which she applies great meticulousness and energy to. Elham now would like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase chocolate products and other foodstuffs to stock up for the holiday celebrations.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs for convenient store.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Sialupe Huamantanga del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas se desarrollan completamente se encarga de ofrecerlas en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más alimento para mejorar la crianza de sus pavos. Con esta acción ella planea percibir mayores ingresos por la venta de sus animales, sobretodo durante esta temporada en la cual la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila, 45, is married living with her family in Sialupe Huamantanga in Lambayeque region, a rural zone located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in farming related activities, especially raising small farm animals for sale.  She raises barnyard fowl in a corral near her house that she feeds on grains and natural grasses.  When they develop completely she sells them to merchants in the area and to the general public.

Lucila wants to expand the business buying more feed to improve turkey raising.  With this action she plans to receive higher income from the sale of her animals, especially during this season when demand tends to increase.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy more feed to improve her turkey raising.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia-Taray Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía” ya tiene 4 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días y la mayoría D. las socias viven en la comunidad D. Taray que está ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. artesanía, venta y compra D. ganado, venta D. chicha, crianza D. cuyes, venta D. artículos D. ferretería,  venta D. verduras, y venta D. abarrotes. 

Fernanda, tiene 43 años y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal D. Fernanda es la venta D. comida. Ya son varios años que abrió un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donD. sirve almuerzo. Utilizo sus ahorros para implementar el restaurante, donD. aproximadamente atienD. a más 20 D. clientes todos los días. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Fernanda que espera recibir D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas pero le gustaría emplear el dinero  D. este préstamo para comprar más gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.   

La socia margarita no está en la fotografía por que tiene permiso D. la junta directiva del banco comunal y no esta presente en el desembolso.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Senor D. la Agonia" has already had 4 years together and it is maD. up of hard working, enterprising women who are on a constant lookout for opportunities to get ahead. And with daily effort they look to proviD. a better future for their kids. The community bank meetings take place every thirty days. The majority of the members live in the community of Taray, located about 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The business activities of some of the members are, for example: craft sales, buying and selling livestock, the sale of chicha drink, raising and selling guinea pigs, hardware store, produce sales, and general store. 

Fernanda is 43 years old and she has three children. Fernanda has a restaurant. It has been many years since she first opened the small restaurant from where she sells breakfasts. She used her own savings to set up the restaurant. She serves approximately 20 clients every day. 

Fernanda requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles. Her restaurant is only modestly equipped with only the most basic inventory and she would like to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks, rice, sugar, and various other types of inventory.

Margarita is a member who is not shown in the photograph and the community bank is in unanimous agreement to exempt her from participating in this loan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, and other inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs. She is 50 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Caraniogan. Beatriz has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. 

Beatriz is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Beatriz A.'s Group".

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Flores De Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio surtida, taller mecánico, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de ropa.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociacion comunal, indica que forma parte de  “Flores de Libertad”  medio año.  Actualmente vive con su pareja y ambos cuidan de sus hijos.  Su negocio es la compra - venta de ropa nueva.  La señora Juana indica que antes de ser cliente de Pro Mujer era ama de casa y negociaba con ropa usada,  sufria por que el dinero no le alcanzaba, ahora que ella se ha capitalizado con un crédito de Pro Mujer, cambió de negocio y vende ropa nueva, tiene un ingreso que le permite aportar a la familia, se siente más contenta.  Por su parte el esposo, quien se encontraba en sala, dice que le gusta que su esposa este en el grupo por que ya esta dejando de ser timida.

El crédito que ha solicitado la senora Juana le permitirá comprar mas ropa y surtir la mercaderia que esta vendiendo. 

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta compartir con el grupo.
texts.en:
The “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” (Flowers of Freedom) communal association will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  Their businesses are varied: vegetable sales, stocked neighborhood store, machine shop, food sales, fruit sales and clothing sales.

Juana, President of the communal association, indicates that she’s been part of “Flores de Libertad” for half a year.  She lives with her spouse and both care for their children.  Her business is new clothing sales.  Juana states that before being a Pro Mujer client she was a housewife and traded with used clothing.  She suffered because money was never enough.  Now that she has capitalized with a loan from Pro Mujer she has changed business and now sells new clothes.  She has income that makes it possible for her to contribute to the family and she feels happier.  For his part her husband, who was present in the room, states that he likes that his wife is in this group because she is starting to be less timid.

The loan which Juana has requested will allow her to buy more clothing and replace the merchandise she sells.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes sharing with the group.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia Del Carmen tiene 50 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. Inicio como una forma de ingreso para su hogar tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad a su cargo. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija, entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que acuden a su vivienda, pero la mayoría de veces ella tiene que salir de manera ambulante a ofrecer sus productos. Para el  futuro desea establecer su negocio en el mercado, en donde transitan muchos clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, tratamientos y pintura de uñas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy emocionada.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Carmen is 50 years old.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for more 4 years.  She started her business as a way of making income for her household.  She has 2 grown-up children in her care.

Sonia currently has regular customers amongst her friends in the neighborhood, locals and neighbors who come to her home.  However, most of the time she goes out door to door to offer her products for sale.  In the future, she would like to set up her business in the market where there are a lot of customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy powders, lip sticks, treatments and nail polish.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan and she feels very excited.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is currently in the business of selling books. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children -- all of whom go to school. Christine borrowed a loan to stock more books to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock books to sell

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Antonieta; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia es docente del nivel primario y trabaja en un colegio nacional de lunes a viernes ,la socia a la vez tiene otro pequeño ingreso que es venta de zapatillas y zapatos de marca como adidas,nike,puma entre otros la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Tacna para comprar su mercadería y así poder venderlos a sus clientes esta actividad lo realiza de vez en cuando de preferencia cuando está de vacaciones.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: María Antonieta is a member of the community bank ” MOSOQ RUNA” in Cusco.  She is 37, married and has three children.  María Antonieta works as a primary school teacher in a public school on weekdays.  She also has a small business selling shoes, including popular brands such as Adidas, Nike, Puma and others.  María Antonieta occasionally travels to the city of Tacna when she has time off, to buy merchandise for resale to her customer base.  She seeks a loan in order to buy inventory of shoes for her business, and is committed to prompt repayment of the credit.

loans.use: to buy inventory of shoes for her store

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married, with four boys, all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Salma decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is married and mother of two children. Her husband is employed and offers support in the family’s upkeep. Josephine runs a bread depot in Mariakani and she has been in this business for 11 years. The business is a success.

This is Josephine’s second time borrowing from KADET and she plans to purchase thirty crates of bread for her shop for re-selling. The income and profits she hopes to make will be directed into servicing the loan and to purchasing more stock of bread. 

Josephine hopes to become a very successful businesslady in Mariakani

loans.use: purchase thirty crates of bread.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren A. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house that they bought on mortgage. His daughter studies in secondary school and his wife, Oyungerel, 34, helps in her husband’s business. 

Baasansuren is an artist. He makes different things like bags, purses, hats, paintings and souvenirs from colored sheep wool. He has been doing this for eight years. He makes items to order and also sells them in souvenir shops. His products are in good demand during tourist seasons. 

He is asking for a loan to buy sheep wool and paints to make beautiful souvenirs to sell.

loans.use: To buy sheep wool and paints to use in his souvenir-making business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa sells different types of underwear in Abura. She will use this loan to purchase more underwear to expand her business. With the new profits generated from this loan, Adjoa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario es una clienta de 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de un niño y vive en casa de sus padres en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito Las Lomas de Piura.

María del Rosario cuenta con una tienda (instalada en su propio domicilio) de productos de primera necesidad, en la que vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y productos de higiene personal. Su tienda es una de las más surtidas en la zona y es por ello que cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes. 

María del Rosario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería e incrementar los inventarios y así poder atender en menor tiempo a sus clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño hijo, ofreciéndole mayores comodidades.

María del Rosario es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad. Su primer crédito fue KIVA y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
26-year old Rosario is a single mother of a son. She lives with her parents in a small rural community in the district of Las Lomas de Piura.

Rosario runs a shop out of her home selling basics such as groceries, candy, drinks and personal hygiene products. Her store is one of the best-stocked in the area so she has a large number of customers.

She is seeking a loan of S/. 2000 from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise and increase her stock so that she can serve her customers in less time. The loan will allow her to continue to grow economically and improve the standard of living of her small son. She will be able to provide him with a more comfortable life. 

Rosario is a regular client of Edpyme Alternativa. Her first loan was with Kiva and she repaid it punctually.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn (pictured here) is 33 years old and her husband, Vuth, is 39 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 
 
Hoeurn sells vegetable. She buys papaya, eggplant and yam and transports them to sell in the market located at another site along the Mekong River. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $400 to build new walls of her house because they are old and broken.

loans.use: To build new walls for her house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned a factory since 2009, where he manufactures blocks. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1200 loan to buy a block-pressing machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a block-pressing machine.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente nacido en Chuquisaca casado con la Sra. Martha, ella es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos, hace 10 años que llegaron aquí a Santa Cruz para buscar mejor vida, en la cual lo encontraron adquiriendo una parcela para trabajar en agricultura, su actividad mayormente es la siembra de  hortalizas y verduras como ser: zanahoria, camote, acelga, repollo y todo lo que el hace producir lo comercializa personalmente al consumidor, el destino del créditos es para la siembra de camote y para el preparado de la tierra, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Vicente was born in Chuquisaca.  He is married to Señora Martha.  She is a housewife.  They have two children.  Ten years ago they arrived here in Santa Cruz in search of a better life.  They have acquired a plot of agricultural land to work.  His primary activity is sowing vegetables and root crops such as carrots, sweet potatoes, chard, and cabbage.  Everything that he produces he markets personally to the consumer.  The purpose of the loan is for the sowing of sweet potatoes and to prepare the land.  He is a very hard worker and grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to sow sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Responsibility for the family is the big responsibility of Yam who is the head of his family. Yam rides a motorbike in Siem Reap. Every day he wakes up early in the morning to find customers so he can support his family. He can earn only $4 per day to give to his wife. Talking about his wife, she doesn’t stay at home; she has a job which involves counting money. With her patience and good characteristics, it is an easier job than others. Yam wishes to borrow an amount of $600 with the aim of repairing his old house.

loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (in the photo), 64, is a widow.  She lives along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons are married and live outside the family home and the daughter is a garment worker.

Ny sells cakes in her village.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.use: To help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is married with 4 children all in school. He has been in farming for 8 years and currently employs 2 farmhands who help him in producing maize, beans and milk. He also operates a motorcycle business for additional income.

Philip has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him pay school fees for his children and remains optimistic that he will be able to buy pure breed cows for better income in future.

He sees animal diseases as the impediment in farming owing to high costs for their management.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario es originaria del municipio de Telica y actualmente se desempeña en la dirección de un colegio del municipio velando por el aprendizaje de los alumnos ya que para ella la educación es lo primordial para el desarrollo.

Su nucleo familiar se compone por 4 personas las cuales son: ella, su esposo y 2 hijos que estudian carreras universitarias en el departamento de León, Ha tenido 9 créditos que le han sido de gran importancia ya que le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida. El crédito que solicita actualmente es para obtener algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar y en especial un mini componente (un reproductor musical con diversas funciones tales como sintonizar las distintas radios de Nicaragua, grabación de voz, acceso a usb, cd y dvd)  para uso familiar de manera que puedan aprovecharlo y así contribuir al desarrollo de su amada familia en el municipio de Telica.
texts.en:
Maria de Rosario is a native of the Telica jurisdiction. She currently works as director of a local school that is known for ensuring that students learn, which for Maria is a very important part of their development.


Her family is composed of 4 people: her husband, their 2 children, who are studying at the University in León, and herself. She has been granted 9 loans, and they have been really helpful for her as they have helped her improving her standard of living. The loan that she is asking for currently is to obtain some appliances for her home, in particularly a "mini-component" (a musical device with various functions that will allows one to synthesize various Nicaraguan radio stations, record voices, and offers access to USB data, CDs and DVDs) for the family to use, and thus contirbute to the development of her beloved family in the town of Telica.

loans.use: to purchase appliances and electrical equipment.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary (pictured above) is 29 years old, and her husband, Khemryn, is 41 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have two children: one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other one is still young. 

Theary is a garment worker, but she has stopped for a while because she is pregnant. Her husband sells rice; he buys rice from Phnom Penh market and sells them to his villagers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.use: to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Dar es Salaam in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.

Sanyu requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Seiyantuki

texts.en:
Seiyantuki is 55 years old, married, and the father of eight children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 11 years, earning income that enables him to cater for his family’s needs.

He was initiated into KADET by a KADET staff member, and he has been a good client who has repaid his previous loans well. He is currently applying for his third loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. He hopes to make more profit, which he will use to educate his children and expand his farming business.

He has dreams of prospering in farming and thus being able to provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Julia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la fabricacion de tortillas, tiene vaR. años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, muchos clientes llegan a comprar desde las 6 de la mañana, este tipo de alimento en nuestro pais se consume con los tres tiempos de comida.
Julia es madre de 5 hijos  los cuales ya son mayores de edad y que en ocaciones le ayudan a repartir sus tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus tortillas, en estos momentos los pedidos son mayores y no tiene suficiente inventario para cubrir con la demanda.
Julia en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en: Julia’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work which is making tortillas.  She’s been in this line of work for many years. Her business is home-based.  She rises daily at 4am to start her production.  She has many customers who come by at 6am to buy.  This type of food is consumed three times a day in our country.  Julia’s the mother of five children who are adults now and sometimes help her deliver the tortillas.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make tortillas because she currently has pending orders that are large and she does not have enough inventory on hand to meet demand.  In her free time Julia goes to church.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en: Dudu has been selling beans and fish in Yei, South Sudan for six years. She is 40 years old; a married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. Her husband is a businessman. Dudu requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans for sale. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and fish for sale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, de 33 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Maurita, su esposa desde hace 3 meses. Aún no tienen hijos, pero viven juntos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Los libertadores de Huari. Aún está conformando su familia, desea muy pronto tener su primer hijo. Por ello trabaja muy duro. Su principal actividad es la ganadería, pues cuida de sus vacas, ovejas y alpacas que cría. Según cuenta le gusta mucho esa actividad, pues es rentable ya que cría animales de calidad. Paralelo a esa actividad, también trabaja mejorando las carreteras de su zona, ahí recibe un sueldo de parte del gobierno local. Con todos esos ingresos está seguro que comenzará a ahorrar para mejorar su casa, que es rústica y abrir un negocio para que su esposa administre. Con ello espera procrear a su primer hijo y brindarle todo lo necesario. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Huari” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nelson de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 ovejas que cuesta un promedio de 100 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Nelson, age 33, is a hardworking gentleman. He lives with Maurita, his wife of three months. They have no children yet and live in their own home in the village of Los Libertadores de Huari. Nelson is still starting his family and wants to have a child very soon. It is for this reason that he works very hard. His main business activity is raising livestock such as cows, sheep, and alpacas. He says that he greatly enjoys this activity because producing quality animals is profitable. In addition to this business, he also does repair work on the roads in his district and receives a salary from the local government. With all of the income that he earns, Nelson is starting to save so that he can make improvements to his rustic house. He also wants to start a business that his wife can manage. When he has his first child, he hopes to have everything that is necessary.

Nelson is a member of the Communal Bank “Huari” and will be receiving his first loan from MFP. He hopes that the assistance given to him will help him to follow through with his plans. Nelson promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With the money he requested, Nelson will invest in the purchase of 10 sheep that have an average cost of 100 PEN per head.

loans.use: to buy 10 heads of sheep.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa nació en la  ciudad D. Urubamba provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació, ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos.
 
Santusa desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Urubamba, ella es profesora y trabaja en uno D. los colegios más prestigiosos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Santusa requiere el préstamo para uso personal para la educación D. sus hijos. 

Santusa se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Santusa pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Santusa, 60, was born in Urubamba, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She still lives there with her husband and their five children.
 
Santusa is a teacher at the most prestigious school in Urubamba.  She has been a teacher for several years and her income from the job has provided her with a good living.

Santusa will use this loan to pay her children's school fees.

Santusa is grateful for the opportunities that this type of lending provides and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.  She belongs to the Tercer Milenio community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa partner in Urubamba.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Bebiana is a married woman with seven children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

Bebiana sells fruits and vegetables to her community. She has been doing this for five years. Bebiana earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month with her business.

Bebiana has requested a loan to buy more bananas and vegetables to sell. Bebiana hopes to earn more and be able to sustain her children's education and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aveina

texts.en:
Aveina is 48 years old, married and she has 4 children.

Aveina is starting a business venture, sewing and selling clothes to local community members. Aveina needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabric & materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2005, Aveina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aveina's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials.

loans.name: Ansou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants. Il exerce le métier de coiffure et tient un salon dans son quartier.Il vend aussi des produits cosmétiques et des produits et articles de beauté.Lors des fêtes, le salon lui rapporte des revenus assez importants qui lui permettent prendre en charge ses deux parents et de soutenir ses quatre frères et sœurs. Il supporte également des frais de location et de factures d'eau et d'électricité.Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 75000f pour acheter du matériel et des produits pour le traitement de cheveux. Son ambition est d'ouvrir d'autres salons de coiffure.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young married man with no children. He is a hairstylist and has a salon in his neighborhood. He also sells cosmetics and beauty products. During festival time, he is able to make a sustainable income and he can take care of both of his parents as well as support his four siblings. He also pays rent, and water and electricity bills. 

To increase his activity, he is asking for a loan of 75,000 francs to buy hair care supplies and products. His ambition is to open more hair salons.

loans.use: to buy hair care supplies and products.

loans.name: Gakurya

texts.en:
Gakuyra is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school.  He owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water.  Gakuyra’s greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past ten years, he has operated a hardware business, selling timber to neighbors and home builders.  Gakuyra faces two major challenges: the high cost of purchasing timber and the cost of transportation.  He dreams of establishing another hardware shop in the future.

Gakuyra decided to join Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.  He will use the KES 30,000 loan to repair his power saw that he uses to cut timber for sale.

loans.use: To repair his power saw that he uses to cut timber for sale.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana Cristina es una joven de 22 años muy carismática y sobre todo trabajadora, es madre de un hermoso pequeño de 3 añitos y junto a su pareja viven en la ciudad de Chincha, ella trabaja muy duro día a día para poder solventar a su pequeño y darle lo que el necesita, en el poco tiempo libre que ella dispone trata de darle mucho cariño a su bebe, junto a su pareja, Ana Cristina solo estudio hasta quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos necesarios, como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, pero el paltillo que mas le agrada es la riquisima "Carapulcra"

Ana Cristina trabaja en la venta de ropa, trabaja 8 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 20 clientes, en ocasiones cuando no tiene quien pueda cuidar de su pequeño mientras trabaja ella, lo lleva junto a ella a donde valla, ya que su esposo la apoya trabajando como chofer de una mototaxi, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene la mejor motivación que cualquier persona pueda tener, su Hijo ya que por el daría la vida y por el es que se sacrifica tanto por salir adelante para que nada le falte.

Ana Cristina está muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mucha más mercadería (ropa), con ello mejorara sus ingresos y así podrá seguir ahorrando para poder realizar su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a su pequeño”
texts.en:
Ana Cristina is a 22-year-old young lady who is charismatic and, above all, hardworking.  She is the mother a beautiful three-year-old little boy and she lives with her partner in the city of Chincha.  She works very hard day after day to make money for her little one and to give him what he needs.  In the little free time she has, she and her partner try to give her son a lot of attention.  Ana Cristina only studied up until the fifth grade because her parents didn't have enough money.  Like every good Peruvian, she likes the national cuisine a lot, but her favorite dish is the delicious carapulca.

Ana Cristina sells clothing for a living.  She works eight hours a day and sees about 20 customers.   Sometimes, when she doesn't have anyone to watch her little boy while she works, she takes him with her wherever she goes, since her partner supports her by working as a mototaxi driver.  She thinks her business is doing well because she has the best possible motivation, her son, because she would give her life for him and he's the reason she sacrifices so much to get ahead--so that he won't be lacking for anything.

Ana Cristina is very happy and thanks Kiva's lenders because it's thanks to their help that she will be able to buy much more merchandise (clothing).  This will improve her earnings and she will be able to keep saving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to offer her little boy a profession.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (summer clothing)

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en: Residing in Battambang province, Phen is 41 years old and a mother of two children. She supports her daily cost of living via rice farming. To help her in earning more income, her husband works at construction site. Including this loan, she is the second borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to cover her plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To cover her plowing fee

loans.name: U.m.c Pri Sch Ii Ken Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleases to present to you members of a secondary school, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL 18,000,000.00 . They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Bintu is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place called Gbewobu, in Southern Sierra Leone, forty-six years old Bintu is married to a school teacher and has 5 children. Two of her children are attending primary school, two in secondary school and the last is still not of school going age. Bintu has served in the teaching profession for 15 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 38 year old Lebanese widow woman and mother of three children who are still attending school. After she lost her husband, she became the main income provider in the family. So she decided to start her own business, she is working at her house selling homemade food in order to help her family to meet the needs of life and live in a good way . She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She tends to help them and to provide them with a good education. This is her first loan and she wants to express her thanks for it

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.en:
My name is Agueda M. and I have been selling  underwear and sportswear for nine years, my clients prefer me because of the attention I give them and my good prices. This business permits me to help support my family and finance the higher education of my three children.

Descripción del Negocio: Mi nombre es Agueda Mejía me dedico a la venta de ropa  interior y deportiva desde hace nueve años, mis clientes me prefieren por la atención que les doy y por los precios. Este negocio me permite ayudar al sostenimiento de mi familia y a financiar los estudios superiores de mis tres hijos.

loans.use: Buying children’s underwear, men’s, women’s and children’s summer shirts, socks of various sizes and bathing suits.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la venta de mariscos. Después de trabajar en albañilería, un familiar lo llevo a trabajar para el entregando mariscos en empacadoras, actividad que le gusto y decidió comenzar a vender el por su cuenta. Obtuvo el capital de sus ahorros de los trabajos anteriores. El negocio lo maneja todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. en un sector cerca de su domicilio. Pablo desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que en periodo de aguaje la mercadería hay bastante y el no puede comprar por falta de capital y desea comprar otros mariscos los que no tiene a la venta y sabe que con ellos sus ingresos van a ser mejores. Pablo tiene 62 años. Actualmente vive con su madre ya que esta separado desde hace 4 años, tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan en lo que necesita. Al momento el desea poder comenzar a arreglar su casita ya que una parte de la casa no tiene techo, y sabe que con el dinero bien invertido de su negocio lograra obtener ganancias las cuales le servirán para lo que necesita.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in seafood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to pay the vendors from whom he buys his products, which will allow him to enjoy discounts for quick payment and give him the capacity to buy more products.

loans.name: Koun

texts.en: Mrs. Koun L. is a 58-year-old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 4 children.  Koun L. works as a recycler, earning about $4/day.  She collects and buys small pieces of recyclable items and resells them in bulk for a profit.  Two of her children help her in this business, and the other two help support the family by working as mototaxi drivers.  This loan will be used for Koun L. to purchase recyclable items from her fellow villagers that she can resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase recyclables to resell in bulk

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Mahfirat Chaborova has been selling women's wear for 15 years. Mahfirat has high school education.She is 48, married with 3 children. Her husband works in construction, all her children have families of their own. Mahfirat sells women's footwear. She took out her first loan of $90 in 2003. Since then she has bought several trading kiosks at the main city markets and expanded her business. Her assets have grown to twice it's original size. In the future she plans to include women's clothing into assortment. She is requesting a loan of $500.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Чаборова Махфират продает женскую одежду, вот уже 15лет. Её 48лет, образование среднее, замужем мать троих детей. Муж работает строителем, дети каждый имеет отдельную семью. Махфират занимается продажей женской обуви. Начала получать займ в 2003году, тогда она получила 90$. После получения займа она приобрела несколько торговых точек в больших рынках города, увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза, и она получает 500$. В будущем планирует добавить в свой ассортимент и женскую одежду.

loans.use: to add women's clothing to the assortment

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania H. is a 33 year old mother living in Roueiss, in the Beirut suburbs. To support her family, Rania sells perfumes. She needs $1200 to buy enough products for her business.
Rania is a previous loan recipient and her past loans have given her the opportunity to sustain and continuously develop her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for her perfumes sales business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
In the village of Quảng Đức everyone knows Ms Nguyễn Thị Hà and her husband Lê Văn Cẩn. Both are 43, the husband and wife are butchers for the last 10 years. Everyday he buys 2-5 pigs, butchers them and sells at the market. Since they are very experienced, they know how to select pigs that are meaty, not too fat. The customers trust them and appreciate the quality of their pork. This time Ms Hà is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy more pigs to stock up the inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ở xã Quảng Đức không ai không biết chị Nguyễn Thị Hà và anh Lê Văn Cẩn. Cùng ở độ tuổi 43, vợ chồng anh chị làm thịt lợn bán đã được 10 năm nay. Mỗi ngày anh đi mua 2 đến 5 con lợn, sau đó về làm thịt cho chị đem ra chợ bán. Làm nghề đã lâu nên chị biết chọn con lợn nào nhiều thịt ít mỡ và ngon nữa nên thịt lợn anh chị bán rất chạy và uy tín. Có nguồn trả hàng tuần tốt chị Hà đề nghị vay mức 450USD làm vốn mua thêm lợn để có nguồn dự trữ cho việc làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in  new product lines

loans.name: Sotowou

texts.fr:
Mr V. Sotowou is a 33 year-old honest farmer in his region. Married and a father of five children, he has great difficulty in managing to support his family with his poor income. The main reason for this is the lack of means to work adequately in order to increase the output of his crops. He would thus need to buy manure and requests a financial contribution of $500, which will enable him to profit from his crops and to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur V. Sotowou est un brave cultivateur de sa localité. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il arrive difficilement à supporter les charges de sa famille avec son maigre revenu. Cette insuffisance de revenu est due au manque de moyen de travail adéquat pour avoir un meilleur rendement de ses cultures. Pour y remédier, il voudrais acheter des engrais et sollicite un apport financier de $500. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser ses rendements et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of manure

loans.name: Ermila

texts.es:
Ermila Rodríguez A. is 36 years old and has an elementary school education. She has 3 children who still depend on her. She lives in the Usquil district of the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad.

Every day at approximately 5 o'clock, Ermila makes fresh anticuchos (kebabs) or salchipollo (chicken dish) from her livestock. In addition to this business, she also raises small animals that she sells to different restaurants in the area.

Before having her own business, she worked on a farm and raised small animals. With much effort, she eventually bought herself equipment to make salchipollo and a small barbecue so she could start her business.

Through a relative, Ermila was introduced to and joined the Banco Comunal "Usquil" and received her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1); with this money, she bought 1st grade potatoes, a gallon of oil and discardable plates.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she'll repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy 3 bags of potatoes, some chickens, and a part of the loan will go to constructing a floor in her house. Ermila's dream is to buy a parcel of land in the city of Trujillo.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ermila Rodríguez A. tiene 36 años de edad, estudió primaria completa. Tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Todos los días, aproximadamente a las cinco de la tarde, la señora Ermila prepara anticuchos o salchipollo. Aparte de este negocio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores los cuales vende a diferentes restaurantes de su región también los sacrifica para prepararlos en su negocio. Antes de tener su propio negocio sólo se dedicó al trabajo en la chacra y crianza de animales. Con mucho esfuerzo compró una salchipollera y una pequeña parrilla los que utiliza en su trabajo. Por medio de un familiar pudo formar parte del Banco Comunal “Usquil”, del cual recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró papa de primera calidad, un galón de aceite y platos descartables. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará tres sacos de papa, una java de pollos y una parte de este dinero lo utilizará para hacer el piso de su vivienda. La señora Ermila tiene un sueño comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of potatoes, some chickens, and a part of the loan will go to constructing a floor in her house.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị L. is 44 years old and her husband 51. They have 2 children: the older one works for Honda factory and the younger one still goes to school. Mrs L. participates actively in cultural events, promoting culture and arts in her village. In 2002 to celebrate TYM 10th year anniversary, her husband (Mr Trung) has produced a play in which she was the main character. She had won the first place prize with her role. Beside these activities, Mrs L. raises pigs to make a living. This time she will expand her pig raising business. She just sold a batch of 26 pigs worth more than 3000 USD, after all the expenses she made a profit of 1000 USD. Right now she has 17 pigs in her stable which are ready for sale. Her business grows steadily and it secures her family income. This time she requests a L. of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị L. là một trong những gia đình văn hóa điển hình của chi nhánh Phúc Yên. Chị L. năm nay 44 còn anh 51 tuổi. Anh chị có 2 con, cháu đầu làm công nhân công ty Honda, cháu út còn đi học. Ngoài việc tham gia vay vốn, chị L. còn tham gia đóng góp nhiều cho phong trào văn hoá văn nghệ của cụm và xã. Điển hình năm 2002 nhân dịp kỷ niệm 10 năm thành lập Quỹ, anh Trung, chồng chị, là người sáng tác vở kịch ca ngợi Quỹ và chị là nhân vật chính đạt giải nhất. Dự án lần này chị L. đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn thịt. Vừa qua chị cho xuất chuồng 26 con với số tiền hơn 3000USD sau khi đã trừ tất cả chi phí còn lãi 1000USD. Hiện tại trong chuồng còn 17 con cũng sắp cho xuất chuồng. Dự án chăn nuôi của chị L. đang rất phát triển và hứa hẹn cho thu nhập ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children ages 10 and 3. She began selling charcoal in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Mariam hopes to receive a loan in order to buy more charcoal for her business so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Boo

texts.en: Boo P. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a good housewife. Every day she stays at home looking after the children and cooking for the family members. Her husband has been a soldier since 1989 and earns a salary of $30 per month. They have four children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. One of her daughters operates a hair salon, earning about $11 in revenue a day, and also there are students. The busiest time that her daughter has is from January to May because these months are the harvest season. People already have collected their pay and also get married during that time. So to enlarge the hair salon business, the family needs to purchase more tools. This will allow the business to grow very quickly.

loans.use: To purchase more hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Tabempa Group

texts.en:
Patrick B. is 38 years old and married with four children. He is the leader of a group that has been working together for one year. Patrick runs a transport service and at the same time sells palm oil. He diversified the business with his previous loan. He says his main dream is to see his four children through their education and he would like to generate income and save for that purpose. He is requesting a loan to add on his savings and purchase one more motorbike.

Of the other group members, Joseph has a small general store and Sampa sells firewood. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,400,000 ($US825) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of firewood, palm oil and groceries and to expand a transport service.

loans.name: Miramar Femenina- Group 4

texts.en:
Ms. Rosa D. has accessed loans from Esperanza for four years.  She has operated her business for five years. She owns a fruit shop where she sells items ranging from bananas to melons. Although she started business a year prior to receiving her first loan, her business needed a strong financial boost from Esperanza.  Her loans are currently used to purchase the fruit that she sells. She is an avid member of her church and also enjoys going to the nearby beach and dancing. Her favorite food is fried fish.  Rosa hopes to expand her business by beginning to sell more items such as chicken.  This will increase her income and allow her to better provide for herself and her family.


Ms. Rosa D. is a member of a 5 person group (Group 4) that is part of a 35 person micro-bank called Miramar Feminina.  In the picture, Ms. D. is first on the left.  She is pictured with her group members and other members of the micro-bank. 

  Rosa's story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza's micro-credit loans.  This group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit.  Each associates in this bank has a similar business, whether it is selling fruit or operating a taxi service. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Sambou

texts.fr: M. Sambou, est un jeune soudeur metallique, installe dans le quartier de santhiaba non loin du centre ville. Il est socilite par la population de son quartier et celle envirronnante ; C'est pourquoi il voudrait ce pret pour renforcer davantage son outil de travail.
texts.en:
Monsieur Sambou is a young metal welder working in the Santhiaba neighborhood, not far from the center of Ziguinchor, Senegal. He is in demand with the locals from his neighborhood and the surrounding area. He would like a loan to buy more tools.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy welding tools

loans.name: Aziza Kambi's Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Aziza K. is 58 years old and divorced. She has four children ages 33, 30, 25 and 16. She started a business a long time ago of buying and selling scrap metal. She collaborates with some people who go around and collect the scrap metal. Aziza then buys the scrap metal from them and resells it to a warehouse or manufacturer for a profit. Her hours vary, but her profit is about US$ 30 per week.

This will be Aziza's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy land, build a house and expand her business. She paid back all the loans successfully. She now hopes to receive another loan to have more capital to purchase more scrap metal.

Aziza is a member of Nguvu Moja group (meaning "together we are one" in Swahili). The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Aziza is with her subgroup. She is standing second from the left.

loans.use: To expand her scrap metal  business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Hernández García tiene 60 años de edad, es casado con 7 hijos todos adultos y viven en sus propias casas. Este señor se dedica hace más de 30 años a la actividad de transporte selectivo (taxi) y con dicha actividad a mantenido a todos sus hijos. Actualmente solo dependen el y su esposa. Sin embargo por las constantes alzas en los precios del combustible la ganancia solo ajusta para los gastos del hogar y por otro lado por el mal estado de las calles deterioran rápidamente las piezas del vehiculo. Sin embargo al vehiculo se le debe dar mantenimiento para que pueda tener mayor vida util,  lo que consiste en compra de repuestos. 

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar las siguientes piezas de repuestos:

Un par de llantas R-1365 para carro las que cuestan US$ 110 cada par, 1 plato de presión para carro el que vale US$ 35 la unidad, 1 batería para carro que vale US$ 90 cada batería, y 1 disco de clotch para carro que cuesta US$ 90 cada clotch.
texts.en:
Carlos Hernández García is 60 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom are adults and live in their own homes. This man has dedicated more than 30 years to taxi work and, with this job, he has supported all of his children. Currently, he supports only his wife and himself. Nevertheless, due to the constant hikes in fuel prices, his income covers only household expenses. At the same time, due to the poor state of the roads, pieces of his vehicle quickly deteriorate. Nevertheless, he wants to repair his car so that it can have a longer useful life, which requires the purchase of spare parts. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase the following parts: One pair of R-1365 car wheels that costs US $110 per pair, one pressure plate valued at US $25, 1 battery worth US $90 each, and 1 clutch that costs US $90 each.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase  car parts: 1 pair of R-1365 car wheels, 1 pressure plate, 1 battery, and 1 clutch.

loans.name: Hadasa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Hadasa M. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of three and 10 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because he is an orphan. Hadasa has been running a maize business since 2005. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets. Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before purchase and specify the exact amount they would like to purchase. Hadasa works at the business for 12 hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by her brother. Hadasa currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 450 USD in order to buy more stock of maize. Hadasa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia B. G. tiene la edad de 39 años,  habita en el reparto Juan Ramón junto a su esposo y hijos. El esposo de la señora trabaja en transporte  para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Esta señora trabaja como domestica en una casa particular y es un trabajo cansado,  y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar ya que sus hijos estudian. Con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de nuestra institución ha logrado mantener el negocio. Con esta solicitud del préstamo  es para incrementar su inventario ya que estamos en temporada navideña y las ventas son buenas, también poder ofertar sus productos variados a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ligia B. G. is 39 years old and lives in Juan Ramón together with her husband and children. Her husband works in transportation in order to help with the household expenses. The plans for the future include improving the standard of living of her children. This lady works as a housekeeper at someone's house, which is tiring work, and she also has a small business selling clothing to help the family financially since the children are in school. Through her own efforts, and the support of our institution, she has managed to maintain the business. With this loan request, she hopes to increase her inventory to take advantage of the holiday season which is traditionally a time when sales are brisk. In addition, she would like to offer a wider variety of products to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for the holiday season.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
La señora  Pilar es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es casada  y  madre de 3 hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 300 compró ropa para venderla. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco. Pilar nos cuenta que todos sus hijos están estudiando actualmente; ella trabaja actualmente en el restaurante del colegio militar
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará  una cocina más grande y mayor cantidad de vajilla, mesas largas.
Pilar desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de una cafetería en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ms. Pilar is a member of the “Las Amigas” microfinance institute in the province and department of Puno. She is a 45-year-old married mother of 3 children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased clothing for resale. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 2 years. Pilar states that all her children are currently in school; right now, she is working at a restaurant in a military school.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a bigger stove, more dishware and long tables.

Pilar hopes to continue working so that she can one day own a cafe downtown.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bigger stove, more dishware and long tables

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouman (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Bougoula Ville de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales: condiments et du savon. Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate 10 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon et 10 cartons de savon. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 18 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles  comptent utiliser pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités..
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouman is composed of six married women who average 32 years of age and two children. They reside in the Bougoula Ville district of the city of Sikasso and do commerce in: condiments and soap.

To carry out their work and satisfy the needs of their customers, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes, ten 50-kg sacks of onions, and ten boxes of soap.

Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali) and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail and mostly for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in residential districts, to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide a little for the family by helping their husband and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap and condiments

loans.name: Oladunni

texts.en: Oladunni is 43 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a journalist. She sells provisions, drinks, and bottled water by retail. She hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
RÍOS C. CONZUELO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Manco Capac N° 323 Int. A del distrito de Calería, tiene 43 años, 01 hijo, y es madre soltera.

Fue invitada a participar en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, aunque fue poco, le ayudo a emprender su pequeño negocio de venta de Juane en las tardes, en el frontis de la casa donde vive.   

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, con el que podrá implementar mucho mejor su negocio, ya que comprará un surtido de insumos que son necesarios para ampliar y consolidar su negocio, por ellos ha planeado comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite y otros por sacos y cajas respectivamente, también tiene una parcela de plátano, que esta cultivando para tener plátano a disposición para su negocio y también  pueda venderlos. 
Esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos y desea que pueda seguir apoyando a más mujeres en esta región, sobre todo a madres solteras como ella que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Consuelo R. C. belongs to the community bank "Las Almendras". She lives in the district of Calería, is 43 years old and is a single mother of one son. She was invited to join Manuela Ramos [a Peruvian MFI] and her first loan was for 300 soles. Although the loan was for a small amount, it helped her start her small business selling juanes in the afternoons in front of the house she lives in. With this 1,500 soles loan she will be able to better set up her business as she will buy a good quantity of the ingredients she needs to expand and consolidate her business. She has decided to buy rice, sugar, salt, oil and other ingredients by the bag and by the crate, as well as a field of plantain which will be farmed to supply her with plantain for her business as well as for retail. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos and hopes the organization will be able to continue helping more women in this area, especially single mothers such as herself who truly need the help.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her business with the purchase of rice, sugar, salt, oil and so on by the bag and by the crate.

loans.name: Aïche

texts.fr:
Madame Aiché C. est une femme mariée de 40 ans, mère de deux enfants qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Sanankoroba  deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Pour des raisons financières, elle quitta très tôt l’école pour exercer le petit commerce d’articles de beauté pour femmes, d’une façon ambulante. Aiché est très réputée pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de l’institution depuis maintenant 5 ans. Après 5 prêts  de groupe (prêt solidaire)  elle est à son quatrième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Elle compte acheter un important stock de produits de beauté à Bamako (capitale du Mali) de différentes sortes qu’elle va  vendre dans son magasin de Sanankoroba à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 .000 FCFA qui lui permettra de rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à ses propres besoins.
Elle désire dans les jours à venir, augmenter le montant de son prêt pour avoir d’autres articles de meilleure qualité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle croissante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aiché C. is a 40-year old married woman with two children, and lives in a traditional household in Sanankoroba, the second administrative region of the Republic of mali. Due to financial reasons, she left school very early to start a travelling business selling beauty products for women. Aiché is renowned for the quality of her products. In her search for supplementary financial resources, she decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 group (solidarity) loans, she is seeking her fourth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She intends to buy a sizable stock of beauty products of different types in Bamako (the capital of Mali), which she will sell at her store in Sanankoroba to a clientele that is mostly female. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and meet her own needs. In the days to come, she hopes to obtain a larger loan to have other top quality items in order to better satisfy her growing clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for women

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric A., a woodworker, is married with five children. For two years, Eric has sold plywood and furniture in Siwdo. He received an education through junior high school. His wife is also employed as a trader in the area.

Eric uses his income to help support his family, primarily by paying bills and school fees. He will use this loan to purchase additional wood that he may either sell or use to make furniture. Eric plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business back into his trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood to sell or use to make furniture

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida tiene 45 años, siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y mejorar su vida, vive en su propia casa con sus 3 hijos; Edwin de 26, Jesús de 23 y Cinthia de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su negocio es la venta de bolsas de mercado, las cuales sale a vender a la calle de forma ambulante, en busca de clientes que deseen llevarse una de sus llamativas bolsas, sus coloridos productos son muy solicitados en los mercados, ya que la gente siempre tiene cosas que llevar hasta su hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes e informarse de las cosas que suceden en su localidad. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el intenso sol, lo cual la cansa mucho y hace que las fuerzas se le gasten, aun así sabe que esforzándose mucho lograra alcanzar sus metas. Para el futuro, espera tener un pequeño puesto donde pueda vender sus bolsas de mercado sin tener que caminar tanto. Este es el primer préstamo de Nelida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy admirada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar más bolsas de mercado para incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Nelida, 45 years old, has always struggled to get ahead and improve her life. She lives in her own house with her 3 children; Edwin 26 years old, Jesús 23 years old and Cinthia, 7 years of age, who are the reason for all of her efforts. Her business is the sale of shopping bags, which she sells in the street as a traveling salesperson in search of customers who wish to take one of her attractive bags. Her colorful products are in high demand in the market as people always have things that they need to take home. What she likes most about her work is to speak with her customers and find out about the things happening in her area. She has been doing this activity for 20 years and the most difficult thing for her it to have to walk all day under the intense sun, which tires and exhausts her, although she knows she is working hard to be able to achieve her goals. In the future she hopes to have a small stand where she can sell her shopping bags without having to walk so much. This is Nelida’s first loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank where she is very admired for the responsibility that she demonstrates. With the 1000 soles requested she plans to buy more shopping bags to increase the quantity that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Asia Aslam Group

texts.en:
Sadia Batool baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone shop.

Rani baji and Rukhsana baji each want a loan to buy raw materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for their food businesses.
