Asia baji is married to Mr. A. who runs a stationery-selling business. He buys stationery wholesale and sells it to the stationery shops and earns income. Mostly shopkeepers give him orders and he fills the orders for them. But nowadays he is out of stock, and therefore Asia baji is applying for a loan to buy stationery, so that her husband complete the order of his customers and saves his reputation on them.

Asia baji is the group leader for these above-mentioned ladies. She also handles her clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes to pay off the utilities.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy stationery to sell

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиер Хикматов проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бахтиер имеет торговую точку на рынке, он торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. До этого он 5 лет работал музыкантом. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы пополнить оборотные средства.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor H. lives in the Gissar district. He is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtiyor has a retail stand at a market, where he sells food products. He has been involved in this type of business for over 10 years. Previously, he worked as a musician for 5 years. Our client is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en: Fotu L., 45, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to villagers 3 days per week.  Fotu has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Fotu’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase spryor, gromoxone, bush knives, planting metal and a spade.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2004, he decided to open his own barber shop in his village to begin a new career. After five years in the business he has decided to expand his business by purchasing merchandise for his shop and that is why he is requesting to borrow $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase marchandise for his barber shop

loans.name: Opeta

texts.en:
Opeta O.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community (0). She is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Puipaa. She is married and has eight adult children. Opeta has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2005, Opeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Opeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fish to sell. 

Opeta is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be her sixth loan from SPBD. Opeta plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Para

texts.en:
Para K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Koteshwor. Her husband's name is Lalit K. and he works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in secondary school.

Para opened her bag shop four years ago to help her husband in fulfilling the household expenses. She sells different types of bags, such as school and ladies bags, in her shop. She buys these bags from the wholesale market. Now she is requesting a Rs 25,000.00 loan to expand her shop. She wants to buy different varieties of bags.

Para wants to use her income for her children’s education and she also wants to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Eufemia Elizabet

texts.es:
la señora Eufemia Elizabet H. tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en el barrio San Jose de San Lorenzo, tiene tres hijos de los cuales los tres estan en la escuela.
Eufemia se dedica a la venta de leña y tortillas tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta labor. 
Eufemia esta solicitando crédito para comprar maiz, cal y leña. 
su sueño es que sus hijos se graduen de la univercidad.
texts.en:
Eufemia Elizabet H., 34, is a single mother. She lives in the San Jose de San Lorenzo neighborhood. She has three children who go to school. Eufemia sells wood and tortillas. She has been doing this for four years. Eufemia is asking for a loan to buy corn, lime, and wood. Her dream is for her children to graduate from the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, lime, and water

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S. (shown with her mom) is 53 years old and sells fruit and cakes in the local market of Phnom Penh city. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$5 every day.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Meas is asking for a loan of US$500 to put into her fruit business to increase her stock of fruit. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will enable her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest in her fruit stand

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.en:
M. Jamolidin is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He grows vegetables and sells them in the market for income. He has been working in this kind of business sphere for almost 13 years and gained much experiences. Jamolidin has a large family considering that he is leaving with his parents. With his large family, Jamolidin works almost everyday to generate revenues for to support his family's living. Because of his family relying on vegetable growing, Jamolidin needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest and with that way to earn enough money for supporting his family. This will be his first loan with IMON International and Kiva and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri P. is 26 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her husband and a son. Since 2008 Meri has rented a shop where she conducts a food trade. Meri’s husband helps her in this business. From her income Meri bought furniture and other necessities for her house. 

Meri needs 900,000 AMD to buy a big lot of cereals and cognac for her shop. From her future income, Meri hopes to increase her business and keep a second shop. Meri is a first cycle borrower in “Nor Horizon.”

loans.use: To buy a big lot of cereals and cognac for trade

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Angela Barabona is a 40-year old entrepreneur living in Norala, South Cotabato. She started with little capital in the amount of 2,500 PHP for her sari-sari (retail) store in 2007. After all her efforts to make her business bigger, she was able to provide for the financial needs of her five children, sending them to school.  

She needs additional capital in the amount of 18,000 PHP as a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to buy groceries for her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel C. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. Maribel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income from the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was very helpful for her family's daily needs. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in her business, and will be the second loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to grow her business and pay off her loan from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
50-year-old Jamila lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Since 1993, Jamila has owned a grocery store where she sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, juices and other products. Jamila has been a microcredit client for six years and has always re-paid her loans on time. When she started her business, she faced few problems except for the lack of diversity in her merchandise. Her previous loans have helped her diversify her merchandise to increase her income. 

She is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise and a cash register. Jamila's business is unique because it offers a wide range of products. Her clients are people from her region like family members, friends and neighbors.  She decided to pursue her business to help supplement her husband's income. More importantly, she wanted to have independent work and be self-reliant. In the future, she plans to continue improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a cash register for grocery store

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier Antonio A. P., 34 años de edad habita en el conocido barrio Laureles Norte este es un Barrio donde la inseguridad social preocupa a sus habitantes, los logros del Señor A. son el tener los medios necesarios para poder tener su propia casa un mejor trabajo y su medio de transporte para poder asentarse emocional mente y brindarle a su futura familia mejores condiciones, el es operario en una zona franca tiene 2 años de trabajar para Tristar. Solicito un préstamo con el objetivo de construir un muro frente a su casa, con esto lograría mayor seguridad puesto que el lugar donde reside tiene altos índices de inseguridad y por que la delincuencia a medida que la crisis nos afecta los promedios de malhechores se incrementan. Espera que se le brinde apoyo para poder ofrecerles a su futura familia y a él como persona un aámbiente más seguro y digno.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio A. P. is 34. He lives in the well known Laureles Norte neighborhood. There is a big lack of safety in the neighborhood, and that worries its inhabitants. Señor A.’s accomplishments are having the necessary means to be able to have his own house, a better job, and a means of transportation. These accomplishments allow him to be emotionally secure and offer his future family better conditions. He has worked for Tristar in the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua) for two years. He asked for a loan in order to build a wall in front of his house. With the wall he will achieve greater safety, given that the place where he lives has a high index of crime. Delinquency caused by the crisis affects us, and the average number of criminals increases. He hopes that he will be given help to be able to offer his future family, and himself, a safe and decent environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of his house

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is a married man of 47 years who is married to Mary Njeri, who is also in business. They have a daughter who is in college and they live in Dagoretti, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town. 

Glenn runs a livestock farming business and he has done so for five years, accumulating a great deal of experience. He sells the cattle to the local butchers who buy them for slaughter. He also sells to other small scale traders for livestock farming and also for milk production.
 
Glenn is among the founder members of his group, and has influenced his group members to join KADET. He has received other loans from KADET and paid them off without delay. He has currently applied for a loan which he will use to add another cow to increase his herd.

He wants to become a major livestock dealer, buying and selling cattle in trucks, so that he can effectively meet the market demand.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase his herd

loans.name: Avazmat

texts.en:
A. Avazmat was born in 1964 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International, he was able to make a lot of progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: rearing young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, Avazmat will purchase young cattle and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pedro está integrado por tres personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y esforzadas ellos son de Ticuantepe, Managua. Este Municipio es de raíces indígenas gran parte de este es rural y se encuentra entre Nindiri y Managua. 

La señora Virginia Azucena Velázquez C. empezó vendiendo pocas gaseosas en su casa luego por medio de los préstamos ha ido creciendo y actualmente distribuye mayor cantidad de dicho producto. Esta señora 45 años viendo la necesidad de acrecentar su negocio y suplir la demanda de su clientela  invertirá  en la compra de mayor cantidad de gaseosas.

Mientras sus compañeros de grupo se dedican otro tipo de comercios la señora Ivania del Socorro G. vende comida y Norlan Dervi C. P. tiene una pequeña distribuidora de pollo. Ellos invertirán el préstamo en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group "San Pedro" is made up of 3 persons who are very hardworking, responsible and dedicated. They are from Ticuantepe, Managua. This town, lying between Nindiri and Managua, has indigenous roots and a large part is rural. Virginia Azucena Velázquez C. started out selling a few soft drinks from her home. Later, through some loans, she increased her business and currently she distributes a large quantity of this product. She is 45 years old. Seeing the need to grow her business and supply the demand of her customers, she will invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of soft drinks. Meanwhile, her fellow group members are involved in other commercial activities. Ivania del Socorro G. sells food and Norlan Dervi C. P. has a small chicken distribution business. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. sells cereals in Nambale Center and stays in Manyole village in the Nambale Busia District. She started her business in 1992 to be able to support her husband in bringing up their seven children and also be self-sustainable and independent. She is forty years old.

She buys her cereals to sell from Chwele town weekly, but she would like to increase the amount of stock she has so she can achieve her future goal of expanding her business. She is very determined to make that happen.

She is requesting a loan worth KSH 30,000 to help her accomplish her goal.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals for sale

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely C. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio. She is 33 years old. Emely is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Emely owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and fruit in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emely is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more beans for resale

loans.name: Assiba Sssi

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans le commerce de vêtements et de sous-vêtements, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999 de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Pour toucher plus de clients elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, sa clientèle est composée de personnes de toute âge ; elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers catégories de  vêtements et de sous-vêtements.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who became specialized in the commerce of undergarments.  She has been in this business since 1999 going from door to door.  She stocks up in Lomé.  To reach more customers, she operates as an itinerant vendor.  Her customer base is composed of people of all ages.  She is faced with a drop in her stock of merchandise.  She would like to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying different types of clothing and undergarments.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and undergarments

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Makabbac, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 63 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living Erlinda plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Erlinda joined ASKI to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. Erlinda is requesting her eighth loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Northeastern and Central areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her vegetable business.

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Mrs. Kam T. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Trabaek Pok Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Peng Rin, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice for a living. In addition to farming, they are also fishermen who earn a small income to support their family. 

Mrs. Kam T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies to support her fishing business. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata J. is a hardworking and very determined woman. She trades in used bags around the cotton tree area - along a busy street in the centre of Makeni City. She is married to a trader who is also an active partner in the business and they have five children.

Fatmata was financed by her husband when she began to trade in bags, which she has done for the past twenty years. She is in need of a loan that will enable her to buy more stock, thereby increasing her profit. She hopes to use the additional proceeds from the loan to educate her children and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more used bags to sell

loans.name: Patrick Mungai

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer aged 42 years. He is married to one wife and has three children. 

Patrick plants tomatoes and sells the produce within Kiambu to other traders and consumers. He has been in this business for the past seven years. He intends to use the loan he has applied for to buy seeds for planting tomatoes in the next season.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality seeds for tomatoes and pepper

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a second hand clothes pack.

loans.name: Rack Top Mack Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité RACK TOP MACK est créé le 28 novembre 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées en groupe par voisinage et par amitié. 

Fatou Bintou F. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe bleue est responsable du Groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et tutrice de 2 autres enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits. Elle vend des oranges, des mangues et du pain de singe:(le pain de singe est le fruit du baobab) Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans au marché du quartier pour faire du porte à porte pour vendre.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant plus de fruits.

Les bénéfices réalisé à partir de son activité lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The Rack Top Mack solidarity group was established on November 28, 2008. It is made up of 10 women, all from the same neighborhood. They formed the group based on their neighborhood and friendships. Fatou Bintou F. (standing at the far right of the photo, wrapped in a blue scarf) is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, the mother of 5 children and tutor to 2 other children. She manages a small fruit business. She sells oranges, mangoes and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree). She has been running this business for more than 5 years. She gets her supplies at the neighborhood market in order go door to door to make her sales. With this new loan she will increase her stock by buying more fruit. The profits gained from her business will allow her to provide for her personal needs and to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mangoes, oranges and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree)

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy B. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 35 years old. Jovy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jovy prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Jovy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jovy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This is Jovy's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita L. is from the village of San Juan. She is 47 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Amelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Amelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sheyla María

texts.es: La señorita Sheyla María G. B. se dedica a la venta de calzado conjuntamente con su abuela, sus principales clientes son personal del poder judicial, Ministerio de Educación, vecinos.La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar, vive con su madre y abuelita en pasaje el eden Acomayo Ica ,sueña con ampliar su negocio tener su casa propia por este mótivo solicita el préstamo, se propone otorgarle  el crédito por contar con buenas referencias acrediticias y personales.
texts.en:
Sheyla María G. B. works selling shoes with her grandmother. Their main customers are staff from the judicial branch, the Ministry of Education, and neighbors. She is single and does not have any dependents. She lives with her mother and grandmother on the street El Eden in Acomayo, an area of Ica. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own house, which is why she is requesting this loan. She qualifies to receive the loan for having good credit references and personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Khursheed Abdul Razaq's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed lives in the small Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is very good at embroidery and takes orders from local people to provide them with finished products to earn an income for the family. She started this business three years ago and now handles a good number of customers.
Khursheed's husband is A. R.. He owns and operates a book-selling business. He has a small shop in the market from where he sells religious and course books and comics. He has been in this business for the past five years. Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy religious and course books and comics to increase his trade. Khursheed hopes that her husband will successfully improve his business by using the loan money. She plans to buy an embroidery machine for her embroidery business with the profit from her husband’s business.
Note: Khursheed is the lady in the picture who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy books for her husband's book-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so she can care for her mango and lime crops

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: O. Fatima est mariée à MOSSOURO Moussibaou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, deux des enfants sont à la charge du couple. Depuis près de vingt huit ans, Fatima s’est installée au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), où elle vit avec sa famille. Fatima assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Fatima a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs quinze ans, Fatima prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce aux tomates, et aussi de la bouillie de maïs) à Kowégbo à Cotonou ; ce qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et de satisfaire ses propres besoins. Fatima achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Fatima désire augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle et donc son revenu ; raison pour laquelle Fatima sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en: Fatima O. is married to Moussibaou Mossouro and has four children, all in school. Only two of the children are in the care of the couple. For close to twenty-eight years, Fatima has lived in the Suru-Léré area of Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin), along with her family. Fatima provides for the family with her husband. She has had very little schooling. For about fifteen years, Fatima has prepared and sold food (rice accompanied by tomato sauce, and maize 'bouillie' - a type of porridge) at Kowégbo in Cotonou; this has allowed her to feed her family and meet her own needs. Fatima buys her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having obtained five loans that were all repaid properly. Fatima wants to raise the volume of her business and increase her clientele and thus her income; this is why she is seeking another loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45 year old businesslady. She has been in business for the last 16 years in a busy environment. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales), among other products. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stocks of cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales). 

She is married and is a mother to six children, who are adults (over 18 years of age).  Two of her children are in college. She hopes to build a home with a proper water supply as well as purchase and develop a plot of land in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 31 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, and detergents in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ek Bo Group

texts.en:
Nineteen members are forming a group loA.. They are located in Veal Kandal village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Ek B., 54 years old, as the group bank president. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loA. for a different purpose. 
 
Mrs. Ek B. and her husband, Mr. Hang Sophy, are farming laborers, where they earn a little income to support their family. They have four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory and one of whom is a student.  They work hard, but they still earn less income thA. is needed to support the family. Thus, she is requesting a loA. to buy rice for food intake.

loans.use: To buy rice for food intake

loans.name: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda

texts.es: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. de 50 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy responsable, la cual se esfuerza a diario por darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad, junto a quienes reside en Armenia en el departamento de Usulután. Vilma posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, así mismo cuenta con un molino, los cuales están en su casa de habitación. Vilma solicita un préstamo a Integral con el gran deseo de poder mejorar su economía familiar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda incrementar los productos de la tienda, y así mismo incluir otros nuevos, con los que tenga la capacidad de atender más pedidos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. is 50 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who works hard every day to give all of the best to her children.  She is a single mother, and she has two minor age children.  They live together in Armenia in the Usulután department.

Vilma has a store selling perishable products and basic needs items.  She also has a mill.  Both her store and her mill are in her house.

Vilma is requesting a loan from Integral with the great desire to be able to improve her family finances.  The reason she is requesting a loan is to be able to increase the products in her store.  She will also include new products, which will give her the ability to take care of more orders from her customers.

loans.use: To buy perishable products and to pay for maintenance on the grinder

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 49 years old and married with four children between 8 and 25. She is well known in the business of selling different styles of clothes. This is her second successful year in this business, which she operates from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding to her inventory of men's and women's clothing.  With additional styles for sale, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business and make better progress.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such in men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Jesus Johana

texts.es:
Johana tiene 36 años D. edad, es conviviente, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza D. ganado caprino y aves D. corral, en los lugares alrededor D. su casa.  Ella los engorda hasta que alcancen un nivel D. desarrollo adecuado para venderlos posteriormente. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

Teresa siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella desea comprar mayor cantidad D. alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Johana is 36-years-old. She lives with her husband three children in the TambogranD. district in the Piura province in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

She raises goats and poultry in the area around her house. She feeds and raises them until they're ready to be sold. This business allows her to help support her family in the daily expenses. 

Teresa always pushes herself to get her family ahead. Currently she wants to buy a large quantity of balanced feed for her animals. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito D. calleria y departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años D. edad y 4 hijos.  Su esposo es profesor jubilado.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. pescado seco y lo hace por el rio Ucayali, para poder ver más rápido su ganancia los venD. directamente a los almacenes que hay aquí en Pucallpa.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos comprará: 1 saco D. pescado liza seco, 1 saco D. pescado maparate seco, 1 saco D. pacotana seco, 1 saco D. pescado boca chico.
La señora Betty tiene que viajar en lancha vaR. días para poder comprar su pescado seco, pasando toda clase D. incomodidades, pero dice que el trabajo es así y que todo tiene un sacrificio, su esposo es el que se queda cuidando su casa mientras ella se encuentra D. viaje.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has four children. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Betty has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for three years. She buys and sells dried fish that comes from the Ucayali River. To earn a quicker profit, she sells directly to the stores located here in Pucallpa.

This new loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy one sack of dried striped mullet, one sack of dried Amazonian catfish, one sack of dried “pacotana” (a local species of fish), and one sack of dried “bocachico” (another variety of fish native to South America).

Sra. Betty has to travel several days by boat in order to buy dried fish, which can be uncomfortable. However, she says the work is what it is and everything requires sacrifice. Her husband looks after the home while she travels.

loans.use: Purchase different types of dried fish

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa. 
Su actividad consiste en la crianza de pollos, actividad que es compartida por tota la familia y también se dedica a la artesanía, principalmente tejido de mantones y bordados. Está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace doce años, el primer monto solicitado de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dicho dinero le sirvió para comprar telas y lanas para elaboración del bordado.
Ahora solicitara nuevo monto de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar unas 30 docenas de pollitos y su respectivo alimento.
Su sueño es comprarse un lote en la ciudad de Tacna y seguir trabajando con su negocio.Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “María Asunción Galindo” which is located in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Juli, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Isabel was able to complete her high school education.

She raises chickens and engages in this business with the rest of her family. Isabel also makes handicrafts, primarily woven shawls and embroideries. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for twelve years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase yarn and wool for making her embroideries.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN. The money will be invested in the purchase of 30 dozen chicks and poultry feed. Her dreams include buying a plot of land in the city of Tacna and continuing to work in her business. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank is being able to work as a team.

loans.use: Purchase 30 dozen chicks & poultry feed

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” tiene  más de 2 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán nuevos negocios sólo después de obtener el crédito.
La sra. Estela M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, panificados, bebidas, etc. para poder mantenerse ella misma y a su familia; desde hace mucho tiempo desea poder aumentar la cantidad de productos ofertados en su puesto de venta, por eso solicita el crédito para poder realizarlo.
Todas las integrantes anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan más de lo necesario para facilitarles los recursos para su desarrollo y formación integral.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” (Women Working Together) has been in existence for more than two years and continues to work with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of its members engage in productive businesses, but the group also includes two women who will start their own ventures after they obtain their loans.  

Sra. Estela M. sells fruits and vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products in order to support herself and her family.  For some time she has wanted to expand her vending post, so she is requesting a loan to accomplish this goal.  

All of the members hope for a better future for their children.  For this reason, they double their efforts to secure what they need to grow and develop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace más de 15 años,  le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos y uno falleció, todos son  mayores de edad pero dos de ellos que son casados  aun viven con ella, tiene dos nietos y uno que esta  por venir. Su esposo es  comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, toldos y semijoyas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, nos dice que la mayoría de sus ventas son bajo  pedido. Trabaja todos los días, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, toldos y semijoyas ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Su sueño es crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) meets every fifteen days in the May 24th Canton in the Manabí Province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, and the variety of plant life. The people are friendly and hardworking. Most of them engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Sra. Dolores became a founding member of the Communal Bank more than fifteen years ago. She has always enjoyed the assistance she receives through the loans. Dolores is 56 years old, married, and has four children, but one of them is deceased. All of her surviving children are grown, but two of them are married and still live with her. Dolores has two grandchildren and another one on the way. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business selling bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry. Dolores sells door-to-door and also from her home. She says that most of her sales are made through orders. Dolores works every day, offering her products on credit and collecting payment every eight days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil every fifteen days or on a monthly basis based on what is needed. She indicates that she has been in business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry since she has a few outstanding orders. Her dream is to grow with her business.

loans.use: To purchase bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Edix Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Edix, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene solamente una hija, ella se dedica a una tienda, la cual inicio por el apoyo de una amiga, en el negocio ofrece productos de consumo necesarios en el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, pastas, ya que estos son demandados por los clientes, y este préstamo le beneficiara en mantener el inventario con mercadería suficiente para vender, fortaleciéndose y brindando un buen servicio a la clientela.
Las aspiraciones de doña Edix, es aumentar sus ventas, atender a más clientes y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Edix, 52, lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  She’s a single mother; she has just one daughter.  She has a grocery store that she started thanks to help from a girl friend.  She stocks basic, daily use household items.

She needs a loan to buy such things as: rice, beans, corn, sugar and noodles since these are what customers demand the most and this loan will help her keep sufficient inventory on hand to sell, strengthening herself and offering good customer service.

Edix’s hopes are to increase sales, tend to more customers and improve her and her daughter’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar and noodles.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: L. is currently in the business of selling tea. She is a 23-year-old widow with 2 children; both of them go to school. L. borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling in the future.

loans.use: purchase more tea to sell

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with five family members of whom two work.

In 2006 Safaa opened his own boutique where he sells cosmetics and accessories. He has four years' experience, and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Xiomara Elena

texts.es:
Xiomara de 46 años de edad casada y con 5 hijos en las edades de 13 a 26 años, reside con su familia en el barrio Las Américas, comunidad que mediante  procesos de sociogestión,   ha logrado adecuar parques y la unidad entre vecinos, que allí habitan,  con el liderazgo de su madre, muchos de ellos son parte de la basta clientela,  que tiene Xiomara en su negocio de confeccionar prendas de vestir como camisas, pantalones y ropa femenina en general.
Desde muy pequeña Xiomara jugaba con sus amigas y ella era la modista de su muñecas, desde ahí mostró su inclinación por este arte, en el que hoy tiene 20 años de experiencia en el oficio y 17 como emprendedora de su negocio,  ubicado en un local de su propiedad. De este negocio  Xiomara se siente orgullosa de su desempeño, adicionándole que es  la actividad que más le gusta y con la que ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, principalmente en lo relacionado con el estudio de sus hijos; en sus operaciones cuenta con una máquina sencilla, una fileteadora y una descubridora, además de herramientas para lograr un buen desempeño, aunque su sueño es tener su infraestructura de negocios con tecnología de punta,  para ofrecer muchos empleos a gente que lo necesitara. 
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará  rollos de telas e insumos para la fabricación de vestidos femeninos que tiene encargados y requiere dar respuesta oportuna a  sus clientes; esta  inversión será exitosa porque entregará a nuevos y recomendados clientes lo producido y con esta negociación aumentará su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, logrando también impactar sus utilidades. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda y en este sentido  se esfuerza diariamente por trabajar de manera persistente para lograrlo; mientras esto ocurre Xiomara  continua generando una rentabilidad no menor del 40%  que planea sostener, para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 46, is married and has 5 children whose ages range from 13 to 26 years.  She lives with her family in the Las Américas neighborhood, a community that is undergoing community organization; under her mother’s leadership the neighbors that live there have united and managed to equip parks.  Many of them are part of the vast clientele that Xiomara has in her dressmaking business.  She makes shirts, pants and women’s clothes in general.

Ever since she was a little girl, Xiomara would play with her friends and she was the dolls’ dressmaker.  Since then she showed her inclination towards this art.  Today, she has 20 years experience in the occupation and 17 running her business located in a site she owns.  

Xiomara is very proud of her development adding that it’s the activity which she most enjoys and with which she’s managed her home especially with respect to her children’s schooling.  

In her operation she has a simple sewing machine, an overlock machine and an interlock machine as well as additional tools to produce quality items although her dream is to have in her business’ infrastructure the most technologically advanced machines to offer employment to people who need it.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy three bolts of fabric and supplies to make women’s dresses she has on order and has to have ready on time for her customers.  This investment will be successful because she will deliver completed orders to new and recommended customers which will lead to an increase in her accounts receivable portfolio which, in turn, impacts her profits.

Her goal for later on is to modify her home so she strives daily with this in mind and works persistently in order to reach it.  While this happens, though, Xiomara continues generating a profit margin of no less than 40% that she plans to sustain so that her business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es:
La señora Nilda es Presidenta de la Alcancia Comunal "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU" elegida por su dones de lider, es una persona muy trabajadora e imparcial.
La señora Nilda posee una bodega muy bien surtida en la cual se dedica todos los dias de la semana, con ayuda de su mayor hija, anteriormente tambien trabajaba 2 dias de la semana como empleada de hogar en una casa y tambien del cuidado del anciano que vive en ella, mientras que su mayor hija se dedicaba a vender en su bodega.
La señora Nilda se esfuerza por sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere ver siendo profesionales en sus estudios, y darle lo que ella no tubo de pequeña para que sean personas de provecho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Nilda is the president of the "Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau" community bank.  She was elected for her leadership qualities.  She is a very hard-working and impartial person.

Nilda owns a very well stocked grocery store where she works every day of the week with the help of her eldest daughter.  She also used to work as a cleaner two days a week, cleaning the house of an elderly gentlemen who she cared for as well, while her daughter worked in the store.

Nilda works hard for her three children who she would like to see become professionals.  She would like to give them what she didn't have as a young girl so that they become good, hard-working people in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, groceries, food products etc.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, age 26, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice field farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Via Ferrea Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres de este comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé, el mismo se formo de un grupo de vecinas y amigas de la zona. Actualmente el comité cuenta con 12 miembros, en el cual todas trabajan de forma responsable y organizadas. Se organizaron con el fin de promover el bien común entre todas las miembros.
La Sra. Myrna es tejedora de ñanduti (tejido hecho a mano para ropas, u ornamentos). Desde pequeña realiza este arte, ya que su madre se lo había trasmitido. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y sus hijos. Ella sueña con algún día poder agrandar su negocio para poder seguir cómodamente con su trabajo.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para continuar con su trabajo, estos materiales consistirían en hilos de todas clases y colores, y ademas de eso todos los tipos de agujas que llegaría a necesitar. La Sra. Myrna tiene mucha fe en el credito y que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the city of Caacupé. This group consists of neighbors and friends from the area. There are currently 12 members in the group, all of whom work responsibly and in an organized manner. This group has joined together to promote the common good among all its members.

Sra. Myrna produces “ñanduti” (a handmade lace used in clothing and decorations). She learned this craft at a young age from her mother. Through her work, Myrna has been able to support her family and her children. Her dream someday is to expand her business so that she can continue to work comfortably.

She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials to continue her business. These materials consist of different types of thread in various colors and different types of needles. Sra. Myrna has plenty of faith that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase thread and needles.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo de veintiséis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. El produce tejas que le vende de muy buena calidad se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las vende a precios accesibles; se levanta de desde muy temprano para producir lo propuesto en el día. José Alfredo es una persona muy carismática siempre recibe a su clientela con una sonrisa en el rostro el está convencido de que puede vencer todos los obstáculos que se le presenten es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima para la producción de teja. José Alfredo tiene la esperanza que su esfuerzo en el trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una seguridad económica para el hogar.
texts.en:
José Alfredo, 26, lives with his common-law wife and son in his own home.  He makes high quality roof tiles and has many customers because of his competitive prices.  He gets up early in the morning to produce what he has scheduled for the day.  

José Alfredo is a very charismatic person who receives his customers with a smile.  He is convinced he can overcome all of the obstacles that stand in his way, and therefore is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy raw material for his tile production.  He has the hope that through his hard work he will be able to give his family a better lifestyle and financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clay.

loans.name: Genebe

texts.en:
Genebe, 35, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She sells snacks and rice cakes, a business she has had for four years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy snacks for resale.

Genebe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks for resale.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is an active lady who supports her family by doing embroidery for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work. She prepares beautiful looking embroidered clothes and earns good profits. Her husband is 45 years old and a janitor in the university.  Shamim has five children. All of them are studying in different classes and continuing their education. 

Shamim needs some capital to improve her embroidery business. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in larger quantities that will allow her to fulfill the needs of her customers and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past three years and has good number of clients. She is confident that an investment will help her improve her sales and profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Sokmorn

texts.en:
Sokmorn, 27 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker and their income is $8 per day. She has one child and he is two years old. Every month she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to repair her house to be better than now, and to be able to send all of her children to study or at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service

loans.name: Eduardo Alberto

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor Eduardo Alberto  se dedica laborar en una empresa de esta cuidad   .es casado y con dos pequeño hijos a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y unas de las necesidades principales es la ampliación de un cuarto de su vivienda  por lo que ha tomado la decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cemento piedra cantera, para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda realizando la ampliación de esta  .por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
Eduardo Alberto works hard for a firm in the city of Managua; he’s married and has two small children that he has to provide necessary conditions to for their growth and development.

One of his current needs is to improve his house enlarging one of the bedrooms so he’s decided to start a home improvement project.  Because of this he’s called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting, sand, cement, and paving stones to start this room enlargement home improvement.  Through this work he’ll provide his children and his wife with better living conditions.

It’s important to point out that through this project he will provide his family with a proper home with all necessary conditions to live in.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a 35-year-old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the coffee business for three years. She got the capital to start the business from her husband’s salary benefits. Her hardship is price fluctuations and her vision is a coffee store that can ably supply the western region plus educating her children. Happy needs the loan facility to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 32 years old, married and the father of six children.

Haydar has been the owner of a workshop that repairs and fixes generators since 2006.  He has more than eight years of experience in this field and a good reputation.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a sliding door, shelves and to purchase a repair kit and parts.  He aims to make more profits and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: fix his shop and buy car parts.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is in her mid 30s, married, and has one child who attends school. She has been selling clothes, fabrics, and sarongs for five years.

Rosemary is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs.  She used the previous loans to increase her clothing sales and take her mother to the hospital.  Rosemary has paid back all her loans successfully.   Her dream is to one day buy land.

Rosemary will share this loan with her loan group Riziki, which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: El señor Gerónimo nacido  en Potosí el es soltero, se dedica a la agricultura en alto Villa Barrientos distante a 32 km de la localidad de Santa Rita, donde tiene su parcela en la cual vive y trabaja, el siembra: maíz, yuca, papa y poroto, pero el mas se dedica a la siembra de yuca, como la  distancia es mucha para transportarse  de Santa Rita hasta su parcela ha solicitado un  crédito,  el cual esta destinado para la compra de una motocicleta, para trasladarse de un lugar al otro, esto ayudándolo mucho, es el  primer crédito que esta sacando. Por cual se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Gerónimo was born in Potosí.  He’s single and is a farmer in Alto Villa Barrientos which is 32 kilometers from Santa Rita.  He has his parcel of land there that he farms.  He grows corn, cassava, potatoes and beans but mostly cassava.  Because the distance between Santa Rosa and his parcel is long he’s asked for a a loan to buy a motorcycle to get from place to place.  This would help him a lot.  It’s the first loan he’s taken out so he feels very grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Amal is selling clothes at her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.
Amal wants to increase her family income and improve their conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Amal's husband.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

Él tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la pesca, fue su papá quien le enseño esta actividad, ya que era un pescador. También José se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su tío.

Los materiales que necesita, para la pesca es el combustible y este lo compra en una ciudad de la zona oriental del país, para la albañilería son los clientes quienes compran los materiales, ya que él trabaja por contrato.

José solicita un préstamo a Fundación campo, para  comprar ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena, para mejorar su vivienda. Puesto que con su esfuerzo y el apoyo de Fundación campo ha construido su casa. José mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia al brindarles una vivienda más confortable.

José desea sobre todo, proporcionales a sus hijos el estudio, y más que dos de ellos ya están en bachillerato.
texts.en:
José, 43, lives with his spouse and three children.  He’s been a fisherman for 20 years; his father taught him this occupation since he was a fisherman too.  José has also been working as a bricklayer for ten years; he learned this occupation from his uncle.

The supplies he needs for fishing is fuel which he buys in a city in the east of the country; for the bricklaying work the customers provide the materials since he works on contract.

José is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy floor tiles, cement and sand to do some home improvements because thanks to his efforts and support from Fundación Campo he’s managed to build his house.  José will improve his family’s quality of life providing a more comfortable dwelling for them.

José wants, above all, to provide education for his children more so since two of them are already in high school.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles, cement and sand to do home improvements.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
 
Eduardo has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks.  He is also engaging in a networking business called UNIGOSYO.  He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Eduardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a 45-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has two children ages 23 and 21.

Danilo is able to provide for his family through his fishing business. He earns 15000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from fishing. He works hard to support his family and improve their living conditions.

Danilo has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help him be more efficient in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Хамрокулу 40 лет, он женат, имеет шестерых детей. Сам он пастух в кишлаке. Пасёт соседских баранов и коз за оплату. Также сам занимается и получает доход от откорма и продажи скота. У него сейчас две коровы и несколько голов баранов. На данный получаемый кредит он собирается купить две большие  дойные коровы, для получения коровьего молока, чтоб его жена могла доить и продавать домашнее молоко в кишлаке. За четыри года кредитования он ни разу не нарушал условия организации, поэтому имеет хороший моральный облик в кредитной истории.
texts.en: Hamrokul is 40 years old, married and has six children.  He is a shepherd in a village.  He watches neighbors' sheep and goats for a pay.  He is also involved in and earns an income from fattening up and selling livestock.  Hamrokul has two cows and several heads of sheep.  He plans to use this loan to purchase two big dairy cows for producing cow milk, so that his wife could milk them and sell farm-fresh milk in the village.  Hamrokul never violated the terms of the organization over his four years of financing, and this is why he has a good moral image when it comes to his credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Jesuvivi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUVIVI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans un même groupe de tontine et vendent toutes dans le même marché. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pauline est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Adrien. Pauline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Pauline mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année environs la vente de la farine de manioc et de l’huile de palme. Pauline s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pauline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUVIVI, un quatrième crédit. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group JESUVIVI is comprised of three persons who are in the same tontine (revolving credit association) and who all make their sales at the same market. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Pauline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Pauline is 44 years old and married to a cook named Adrien. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple has five children, some of whom are in school. Three of the children are still dependents. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Pauline has been running a business for about thirty years selling cassava flour and palm oil. She stocks up from a region in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Pauline and the other members of the group JESUVIVI are requesting a fourth loan. The first three loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava flour and palm nuts to process

loans.name: Toshkentboi

texts.ru: Тошкентбой трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, также предоставлением услуг парикмахера. Также на отходы от сельхозкультур содержит скот. По бизнесу ему помогает жена. Они вместе работают и прибыль тратят на содержание семьи и воспитания детей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 2500 сомони для покупки корма для скота. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Toshkentboi is a hardworking young man.  He is married and has two children.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops and also provides barber services.  In addition, he uses leftovers from the agricultural crops to keep livestock.  Toshkentboi's wife helps him with the business.  They work together and spend the profits to support the family and raise their children.  Toshkentboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2500 somoni to purchase livestock feed.  He relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 28 years old and married with four children. For the past two years she has had a pigpen from which she has sold grown and matured pigs.

Ailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs. With her profits she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary is 42 years old. She is the mother of six children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and rice for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband runs a motor taxi service. He earns about $3 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Vary is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more rice to resell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be humble. 

Judy operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her grocery store business. She will use the KES15,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to manage her financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 27 años, está casada con Alberto y tiene  03 hijos con quienes vive en su vivienda hecha a base de material noble. María se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, golosinas, fideos, leche, entre otros productos que tienen buena demanda entre sus clientes. Desde muy temprano abre su negocio logrando atender a sus primeros consumidores que en su mayoría son agricultores porque desde muy temprano preparan sus alimentos para la jornada del día.
