Desempeña esta  labor hace más de 06 años y comenta que siempre le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y agradece por la confianza que le brindan para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como conservas, sacos de arroz, leche,  entre otros.

loans.use: Compra de productos al por mayor tales como conservas, sacos de arroz, leche, entre otros.

loans.name: Qui Sait L'avenir Group

texts.fr: "QUI SAIT L'AVENIR" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Alvéine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 26 ans et n'est pas mariée. Alvéine est mère d'un enfant, qui n'est pas encore scolarisé, mais qui vit à sa charge. Il y a huit ans environs, Alvéine vend des produits vivriers (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de nourrir son enfant. Alvéine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Alvéine et les autres membres du groupe "QUI SAIT L'AVENIR" sollicitent pour une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Mahoukpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPEDJI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Parfaite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Parfaite âgée de 26 ans, est mariée à un certain Jacques. Le couple n’a pas d’enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Parfaite vend depuis trois ans des conserves et des savons. Parfaite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Parfaite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUKPEDJI sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des savons.

loans.name: Rojanie

texts.en:
Rojanie is 27 years old and has 2 children. She is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Rojanie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rojanie has been running her business for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rojanie would like to save money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rember Saturnino

texts.es: Rember es un hombre trabajador de 39 años que tiene 3 hijos y vive en la localidad rural de Cabanaconde, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; Rember además se dedica a la agricultura orgánica, especialmente al cultivo de papa, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder sembrar papa orgánica, es decir, para comprar semilla orgánica de papa y para preparar el terreno agrícola con abono orgánico. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y contar con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abono orgánico para obtener una cosecha de mejor calidad y mayor rendimiento

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 46 years old is a resident who from Kratie province. For her living condition, she is growing cassava and soybean to get income. She can earn more income for her family via rice cropping. She has been with her businesses for 28 years and it returned her to save from daily income about 5 USD per day. Because of lacking fertilizer, she could not get good yield from her farm in this year. For Mom, this is her second micro loan with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loan. She can improve her family’s business and her living condition better than before. Mom will use her loan portion to buy more fertilizer, seed input her farm and pay for plowing fee in order support her farmland grow well. She hopes that this new loan can make her family’s standard live in better condition than last year.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, seed input her farm and pay for plowing fee in order support her farmland grow well.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred T. is an active member of Life in Africa. He has proved himself to be a very hard worker as a sander and bracelet maker for the Invisible Children Bracelet project.

Fred is a father of four children. It is very expensive raising children and providing them with school fees, food, medical care and housing. He manages but knows that there are ways he could improve their standard of living.

When his father died, Fred inherited three, two room houses in Makindye which is a suburb of Kampala. His family currently lives in one of the houses and he rents out the other two. But the houses are only partly finished and so he can only charge a small rent. If the houses were properly finished, he could rent them for more money and this extra money would enable his family to live an easier life. It would also provide better housing for his tenants.

For the reasons above, he requests a loan in the amount of 700,000/=. He will be able to repay this loan in 12 months. He will be paying 70,000/= per month.

He will use the loan as below:

Cement 10 bags each bag at 19,000/=............................190,000/=

Sand 2 trips each at80,000/=...................................160,000/=

Doors 3 each at 60,000/=...................................... 180,000/=

Windows 3 each at 40,000/=.....................................120,000/=

Labour..........................................................50,000/=

Total..........................................................700,000/=

Fred's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by his community of peers at the Life in Africa WE Center in Kampala. He has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest he will pay on this loan to support the Community Guaranteed Lending Team at Life in Africa. For more about Fred, his life and his worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/fredT.

loans.use: Buying Materials to complete house

loans.name: Deyse

texts.en:
Deyse has a small seamstress’s workshop in her home. She began the business because she learned this vocation when she left school to work for her parents in their workshop. In the beginning she only did sewing for family and friends. Now she continues to offer this service and makes shirts and uniforms to deliver to the shops and commercial centers of area where she lives.

She would invest the loan in an industrial sewing machine, as a way to improve the quality of her products. She has all the confidence that her business will grow and she will be able to continue reinvesting in it.

Deyse is the mother of 4 children. She is married and 40 years old. She depends on her business to support her family. She has hope that this loan will give her financial security and will allow her to save for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Deyse tiene en su vivienda su pequeño taller de costura. Deyse empezó el negocio porque ella aprendió este oficio cuando dejo de estudiar y sus padres la emplearon en un taller de costura. Al principio solo recibía costuras de sus amigos y familiares. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo este servicio y confecciona camisas y uniformes para entregar en los almacenes y locales de la bahía. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en una maquina industrial y así poder perfeccionar mejor su mercadería. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que su negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones. Deyse es Madre de cuatro hijos, casada tiene 40 años. Ella depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia. Ella tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y puede permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Mahtab

texts.en: Mahtab is 31 years old and live in a household of seven people in District 11 of Kabul City. She has a tailoring business and sews many types of clothes like pants, coats, etc. She is participating in the loan program so she can buy a better machine, more fabric and other tailoring materials. She also has orders to sew clothes for a shop that contracts with local tailors. A new machine and sewing materials will enable her to make more clothes to sell to customers and the contractor shop. This will greatly improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shah Jan

texts.en: Shah Jan lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is divorced and lives with her brother. She is a tailor and works at home. She sews clothes at home and her brother sells them in the bazaar. She took her first cycle group loan and bought tailoring materials and made a good business and found more clients in the bazaar. She wants to take anther loan to expand her business and make a good life for herself. She wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Odion

texts.en: Odion U. is 35 years old.  She is a widow with 4 children.  She has been in business since 1996.  She sells different types of fruit such as pawpaw, pears & oranges.  These she buys on the tree in the bush, then harvests them and takes them to the market to sell.  She is requesting the loan amount above to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Maribel Maruja

texts.es:
In the few years since Maruja and Daniel got married, they have worked hard in their creative craftsmanship to successfully obtain a sewing machine and improve their resulting blankets and embroidery with which they have increased demand and income. With the savings they have been able to generate thanks to their efforts, they have obtained a small piece of land where they hope to give their seven-year-old daughter a pleasant place to live and play.

The couples' enterprising and optimistic spirit has helped them grow economically, but they still face great difficulties that effectively restrict them. The decoration of blankets for export requires too much time for their one machine. With an additional machine, they could keep up with demand and double their production. Their bold dreams may fall apart if we do not help with their request for a $500 loan that will help them consolidate their tiny enterprise and one day begin the construction of a house on the land that they bought years ago. With your help, they will keep weaving the colorful dreams of their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

A los cortos años después de haberse casado Maruja y Daniel, han luchado duramente en la actividad artesanal para lograr obtener una máquina de telares y mejorar sus trabajos de fabricación de mantas y bordados con el cual han podido aumentar sus pedidos e ingresos económicos.Con los ahorros que pudieron generar gracias a su desempeño han adquirido un terrenito con la añoranza de dar a su pequeña hija de 7 años un lugar apacible donde jugar y vivir placenteramente.El espíritu emprendedor y optimista de esta pareja ha hecho que hasta el momento puedan crecer económicamente pero aún tienen grandes debilidades que limitan este hecho de manera total porque la elaboración de mantas para exportación les demanda demasiado tiempo debido a que cuentan con una sola máquina y por este motivo requieren de una adicional para cumplir con la demanda y doblar su producción. Éste ánimo impetuoso se puede ver frustrado si no accedemos a la petición de prestarles la suma de 500 dólares que le ayudará a consolidar su pequeño centro empresarial y empezar la construcción de su casita en el pequeño terreno que adquirieron años atrás. Con tu ayuda seguirán tejiendo los coloridos sueños de su pequeña.

loans.use: Purchase of a machine for the making of blankets

loans.name: Goma Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is a 64 year old lady who lives in Saimbu Bhainshepati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming. She has four members in her family including herself. Her son works in a private office and her daughter is a teacher at a local school.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Kamal Bahadur M., opened their tea shop two years ago. They make and sell tea, and they also sell biscuits, cakes and other fast food. Now Mrs. M. is asking for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy some furniture for the customers.

loans.use: To buy furniture for the customers

loans.name: Herman

texts.es:
Herman is a 37-year-old man; his wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children. Herman works as an electrician and currently works for a business called ALBAPOR. He receives a monthly salary from this job, and on weekends and holidays, he offers his services as an electrician.

Herman has worked for ALBAPOR for many years, since the opening of the business, and in parallel, he works as an electrician for businesses or private homes.

Because of the time he has worked for ALBAPOR, he is part of the personnel and does not compete with the business, in addition, the competition for electrician jobs is low because there is a high demand but not a lot of people offering this sort of service in the city of Portachuelo.

The fees Herman charges are accessible to everyone, which is an advantage for Herman because so many people seek his services.

RIght now, Herman has another loan from Agrocapital, and he has been showing good behavior with his existing loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Herman es una señor de 37 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa y también cuida a sus hijos. Herman se dedica prestar servicios de electricista y actualmente trabaja como dependiente de una empresa que se llama ALBAPOR, en esta empresa el percibe un sueldo mensual y los fines de semana y días feriados se dedica a prestar sus servicios como electricista.

Trabaja hace bastantes años en ALBAPOR desde su la inauguración de la empresa hasta la fecha y paralelamente el mismo tiempo trabaja como electricista en empresas o casas particulares. Debido al tiempo de trabajo en la empresa ALBAPOR el es parte del personal fijo por lo que no representa una amenaza, por otra parte en el rubro de servicios de electricidad la competencia es baja ya que no hay mucha oferta de este servicio en la ciudad de Portachuelo. Los precios que cobra por otorgar sus servicios son bastante accesibles a todo bolsillo, por lo que esto se constituye en una ventaja más para Herman ya que muchos clientes lo buscan. Actualmente tiene una deuda más aparte de la presente en Agrocapital, pero en ambas tiene un comportamiento bueno.

loans.use: Working capital  (Capital operativo para comercio de apicultura)

loans.name: Yavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yavi A. was born on December 31, 1967 in Gamé in the county of Zio. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband, a reseller like her, invests very little in the household expenses. Having completed only a few years of schooling, she started to sell corn very early, wood coal and others in Tsévié and in the neighboring markets. Dynamic and honest, she has benefited from two loans that have been reimbursed without problems. To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of $700, which will be used only for the resale of corn and wood coal. Thanks to the income she will be able to cope with the numerous family expenses and thus improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Yavi est née le 31 Décembre 1967 à Gamé dans la préfecture du Zio. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son époux revendeur comme elle, investi très peu dans les dépenses domestiques. Ayant seulement fait quelques années d’études, elle a commencé par vendre très tôt le commerce de maïs, du charbon de bois et autres à Tsévié et dans les marchés voisins. Dynamique et honnête, elle a bénéficié deux fois de suite du crédit qui sont tous remboursés sans difficulté. Pour renforcer, son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui sera consacré uniquement à la vente de charbon de bois et du maïs. Grâce aux revenus elle pourra faire face aux nombreux dépenses de la famille d’où une amélioration de leur condition de vie.

loans.use: Sale of wood coal and corn.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is 66 years old and lives in the district of Usquil in La Libertad, Peru. She has 5 children, none of whom are still at home or dependent on her. She was only able to study until the third grade because her parents were not able to pay for a complete education.

For a long time, she worked buying and selling animals. Little by little she saved enough money to buy her house, where she set up a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner to her customers. Her main customers are the people who live in her area, as well as others who come from farther away. To get to where she is today, Guillermina had to go through some difficult times, including a collapse of part of her house. Although she lost a lot, she still kept going, rebuilding with a great deal of effort and work.

She is part of the communal bank called Usquil, which granted her first loan to help her build her business after the damage to her house. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy supplies for her restaurant, including cases of sodas, bags of rice and other ingredients needed to prepare her meals.

La señora Guillermina tiene 66 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Tiene cinco hijos, ninguno depende de ella. Estudió solo hasta el tercer grado de primaria debido a que sus padres no tuvieron mayores posibilidades para brindarle su educación completa. Durante mucho tiempo se dedicó a la compra y venta de animales menores, poco a poco con las ganancias que obtenía, iba ahorrando para comprar su casa. Ahí instaló su restaurante que actualmente lo mantiene, prepara desayunos, almuerzo y cena. Sus principales consumidores son los pobladores de la zona y también vienen de otros lugares. Para llegar a las condiciones en que ahora se encuentra, ha tenido que pasar desagradables momentos. En una oportunidad una parte de su casa se derrumbó, tuvo muchas pérdidas materiales, pero aún así ella siguió adelante y reconstruyó su casa con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. La señora Guillermina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Usquil” el cual le dio su primer crédito de S/.300.00, este dinero le fue de gran ayuda para implementar su negocio ya que había sufrido daños a causa del derrumbe. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará: 10 cajas de gaseosas entre grandes y pequeñas, 2 sacos de arroz y un huacho entero para cocinar. Su meta en el futuro es modernizar y ampliar su restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR HER RESTAURANT, INCLUDING CASES OF SODAS AND BAGS OF RICE.

loans.name: Gidin

texts.en: Gidin adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Gidin harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa  barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Gidin mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Modal untuk membeli barang bekas

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Vasyl has sold agricultural products such as potatoes, flax and mushrooms in the central market of Unyatichy, Western Ukraine. A married father of two, Vasyl is determined to provide a better living for his entire family. He currently has about $2400 in inventory and his monthly profit is about $1400.

Vasyl is hard working and persistent, giving him the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Vasyl has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. Currently he is seeking a loan to purchase raw vegetables wholesale and expand his business. With the increased income, Vasyl plans to continue growing his business and improving the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: Vasyl would like to purchase inventory wholesale for his agricultural products business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan H. builds round concrete tables and chairs made with cement. On average, he can earn around $70 a day.Most of the customers who come to purchase his furniture are from wealthy families. People purchase a round concrete table and chair to put in front of their house with a small shelter to protect them from sunshine and rain. It is a good pleasure place when they welcome guests or friends.

He lives in the outskirts of town with his family. All of his family members are involved in the business, including his wife.

His business has the potential to make more income for the family, so he would like to request a loan to purchase more sand, cement and other tools to increase his inventory and thus sell more furniture. (His wife is pictured because Mr. Phan H. was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more sand, cement and other tools to build more round tables.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel M. is a native of the district of Somotillo. He has worked arduously in order to improve the living conditions of his beloved family. For several years, he has been looking for ways to improve his home and has begun reconstruction of his deteriorating house. Today, he is in the position of not having sufficient financial resources to continue with the final stage of reconstruction. For this reason, he approached Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of construction materials and manpower.

The loan, which will greatly reduce the risk of suffering an accident as a result of the poor condition of the home, will benefit his family as much as it will benefit José.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José Manuel M. es originario del municipio de Somotillo y se dedica a laborar fuertemente por el compromiso de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia. Por varios años ha venido buscando la manera de mejorar su vivienda y lo ha comenzado a hacer reestructurándola por la razón de que había estado deteriorada. Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de que no posee el recurso económico para continuar con la etapa final de la reconstrucción y para ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y mano de obra.

Con el crédito se beneficiará tanto él como su familia de esta manera reducirá en gran escala el riesgo de sufrir un accidente a causa del mal estado de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
For Silvia the most important thing is the well-being of her family, through her work she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. She dedicates herself to the production of fruit, especially citrus fruit, although her work is very hard and tiring because of the strong sun, she knows that she is being rewarded with the love and smiles of her children. But without a doubt, her labor makes her feel useful as she helps her partner sustain their family, they both make an effort to succeed and do their best at their jobs. The difficulties that they face now come from a lack of money to acquire the necessary fertilizer for their cultivated lands, for this reason they request this loan, to better themselves and increase their production, a quality fertilizer will produce a quality fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Silvia lo más importante es el bienestar de su familia, con su trabajo trata de solventar los gastos de los suyos y brindarles tranquilidad. Ella se dedica a la producción de fruta, en especial de cítricos, aunque el trabajo es muy duro y fatigante por el fuerte sol, sabe que es recompensado con el amor y la sonrisa de sus hijos.Pero sin duda, su labor la hace sentirse útil y ayuda a su pareja con el sostén de la familia, ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar lo mejor de sí en su trabajo.Las dificultades que ahora tienen es por la falta de dinero para adquirir los abonos necesarios para sus terrenos cultivados, por ello que solicitan el presente préstamo, para la mejora y aumento de su producción, ya que un abono de calidad, se reflejará en un fruto de calidad.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for their fruit plantation.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Née à Kpélé- Elé en 1946, Madame A. Virginie  est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de produit de beauté dans la localité. Très dynamique, elle gère bien ses activités. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’acheter en grande quantité les produits de beauté afin d’augmenter ses revenus et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Virginie A. was born in Kpélé-Elé in 1946. She is married and the mother of two children. Her primary occupation is the sale of beauty products. She is energetic and manages her business well. She is requesting subsidization to allow her to purchase a large quantity of beauty products, in order to boost her income and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of beauty products

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: Dama D. Blandine est née le 11 Juin 1968 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du BENIN. Mariée à monsieur AKPLOGAN Emmanuel, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants: Bertrand, Jeanne, Claudine, Pierrette et Charles. Seuls Pierrette et Charles sont encore à sa charge. Elle vend du pétrole et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts à ALIDé. Pour s'approvisionner afin de combler l'attente de ses clients qui sont dans leur majorité des détaillants, elle sollicite le renouvellement de crédit pour l'obtention de son troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Blandine D. was born on June 11, 1968 in Cotonou, in the county of Littoral, in the south of BENIN. Married to Mr. Emmanuel AKPLOGAN, she is the mother of five children: Bertrand, Jeanne, Claudine, Pierrette, and Charles. Only Pierrette and Charles are still in her care. She sells kerosene and has already benefited from two loans with Alidé. To get her supplies in order to fulfill the expectations of her customers, who are mostly retailers, she is requesting this loan renewal as her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 drums of kerosene

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La microempresaria Yolanda Aragón V. tiene 52 años de edad es casada con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad y viven en sus propias casas. La señora Aragón se a dedicado desde hace mas de 25 años a administrar una pulpería en el Bº Fátima de la ciudad de Bluefields. Con este negocio a podido costear los estudios de sus hijos los cuales todos son actualmente profesionales.

Sin embargo actualmente convive con su marido y dos nietas las que estudian en nivel primario y a las que les garantiza el sustento diario, esto debido a que los padres se encuentran fuera del país. Cabe señalar que aunque en el sector que habita la señora Aragón existen varias pulperías, ella mantiene sus clientes que tiene desde hace muchos años.

Necesita que se le financie lo siguiente: 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 50 dólares cada quintal,  3 quintales de arroz nacional a US$ 45 dólares cada quintal,  3 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a US$ 32 dólares cada bidón, 5 docenas de sopa magui a US$ 3 dólares cada docena, 6 docenas de jabón de lavar a US$ 6 dólares cada docena, 10 cajillas de huevos a US$ 3.50 dólares cada cajilla, 4 bolsones de papel higiénicos a US$ 7 dólares cada bolsón, y 3 docenas de leche la lechera a US$ 30 dólares cada docena.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Yolanda Aragón V. is 52 years old, married, and has five adult children who live in their own homes. Señora Aragón has been running a small store for 25 years in Bº Fátima in the town of Bluefields. Her business has enabled her to pay for the education of her children who are now all professionals. Nowadays she lives with her husband and two granddaughters who go to primary school. She is responsible of providing their daily meals because their parents live overseas. It should be noted that, although there are several similar stores in the neighbourhood where Yolanda lives, she has kept the same customers for many years. She needs money to buy the following: 2 100kg bags of American rice (US$50 per bag), 3 100kg bags of local rice (US$45 per bag), 3 100kg bags of sugar (US$30 per bag), 3 large cans of oil (US$32 per can), 5 dozen packets of Maggi soup (US$3 per dozen), 6 dozen packets of soap (US$6 per dozen), 10 boxes of eggs (US$3.50 per box), 4 cartons of toilet paper (US$7 per carton), and 3 dozen cartons of La Lechera milk (US$30 per dozen).

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 100kg bags of American rice, 3 100kg bags of local rice, 3 100kg bags of sugar, 3 large cans of oil, 5 dozen packets of Maggi soup, 6 dozen packets of soap, 10 boxes of eggs, 4 cartons of toilet paper, and 3 dozen cartons of La Lechera milk.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vượn tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Trong suốt 7 năm tham gia Quỹ chị Vượn đều sử dụng vốn vay đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.  Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi 10 con lợn cho thu nhập 2.000.000/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm 300.000đ từ lương làm cán bộ thôn của chồng. Với mức thu nhập nay gia đình chị cũng có điều kiện để đầu tư tốt hơn cho 1 người con đang đi học. vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 5 con lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Vượn joined the Fund in 2001. Over the last 7 years, she regularly used the loans to invest into animal farming. Currently, her family is raising 10 pigs for a revenue of 2.000.000đ per month. There is also an additional revenue of 300.000đ from the husband's salary as village cadre. The family is considering to invest further, in order to allow one child to go to school. For the next round, she would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to buy 5 additional pigs to breed, as well as pig feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. Adelaida is 75 years old and married with six children. Adelaida sells Biolife natural remedies, which prevent and treat various medical ailments. She sells her products to friends, family members and neighbors by catalog and on credit. Adelaida needs a loan of 600 soles to buy more natural remedies to sell. Adelaida’s dreams are to improve her home and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Adelaida es del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga. Adelaida es casada, tiene 75 años y 6 hijos, Adelaida vende productos naturales llamado Biolife para el tratamiento y prevención de enfermedades, ofrece a amigos familiares, vecinos, ofrece a través de catálogos, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito. Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos naturales. Los sueños de Adelaida son mejorar su casa y negocios.

loans.use: Buy natural remedies

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha N. is 55 years old. She is married with eight children. At the moment, two are still in the senior high school. Martha has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel for seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes.

Martha's production is on a small scale due to inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. Martha believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband, provide food, and finance her children’s education.

Martha belongs to a community group called Nyame Nhyira, meaning God Blessing Trust Group. Her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan. She said she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and gallons to store her finish goods.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa T., 50 years old, is the mother of seven children - three boys and four girls, some of whom are out of school and living independently, while others attend junior and elementary schools. Her husband is a maize farmer.

Residing with her family in Offinso, a farming/commercial town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, Adwoa has been a trader for 10 years, dealing mainly in plantains and bananas. She buys her produce from the farmers in her community and those in nearby villages and sells to community restaurant operators and retailers. When plantains become scarce, she buys and trades whatever other produce is available.

Adwoa is now requesting a loan to buy plantains on a larger scale to meet customer demand and increase her profit margin, her greatest desire being to help her children attain higher education.

loans.use: To procure more plantains and bananas.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana D. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Christiana sells cosmetics and groceries at Broyinbima near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband operates a sawmill. Christiana uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometime the children's school fees. Christiana will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and groceries to sell

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana T. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara”, vive en el Jr. Circunvalación Nº 1671, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre 01 hijo, que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja , empezó vendiendo en su casa comidas preparadas, y a la venta de pollos vivos. Tiene 08 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, asados y juanes, ubicada en la Plazuela Fernando Belaunde Terry, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 04 meses, desea invertirlo, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprar más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.

Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Liliana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana T. P. belongs to the “Santa Bárbara” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Circunvalación Nº 1671, Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is married, is 27 years old, and is the mother of 1 son who is dependent upon her. With the first loan for S/.300.00, motivated by her husband, she began selling prepared meals from her home and selling live chickens. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 8 years. Today she sells food, bbq, and “juanes” (a traditional dish), in the Plazuela Fernando Belaunde Terry, where she sells to the residents of the community. With this loan for S/1,000.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she wishes to invest it in expanding her business, buying tables, chairs, glasses and pots and ingredients used to daily prepare her meals. She usually makes the decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Today she feels like an independent woman, responsible for her loan payments and making her own decisions. Liliana thanks Manuela Ramos in permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more tables, chairs, glasses and ingredients

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Très tôt cette dame a commencé le commerce de pagnes, de tissus, chaussures et divers articles de façon ambulante.son point d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé,elle fait ce commerce depuis 1990 ce qui a fait qu’à ce jour  elle a une parfaite maîtrise de son activité. Elle a une clientèle à majorité composée de femmes, à ce jour le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande élevée de sa clientèle, elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de sortie, des Tissus et pagnes, 20 chaussures  et divers articles. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Very early on, this woman started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, shoes, and various other items, as a saleswoman. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She's been in this business since 1990, and has now learned all its ins and outs. Her clientele is mostly composed of women. At this time, her stock does not enable her to meet high customer demand. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 25 handbags, fabrics and pagnes, 20 pairs of shoes, and various other items. She's married and has four children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 handbags, fabrics and pagnes, 20 pairs of shoes, and various other items

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 59 años, vive solo, ya que está separado de su pareja con la cual tuvo a tres hijos; Martha de 32, Robert de 28 y Mario de 26, los cuales ya tiene una vida independientemente. Desde hace más de 32 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo, ya que este negocio le da tranquilidad y estabilidad, y gracias a él se mantiene ocupado. Lorenzo vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde en el mercado, que es donde tiene su puesto, gustándole mucho su trabajo. La carne de pollo tiene que venderse en un tiempo corto porque no siempre se mantiene fresca y este es su principal problema, ya que tiene que vender su mercadería en el tiempo estipulado, pero felizmente las ventas son buenas y casi nunca tiene estos problemas, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Además tiene una sobrina que lo ayuda esporádicamente, haciéndole más fácil el trabajo. Lorenzo se encuentra en el segundo préstamo con MFP, y es el único varón de su grupo, siendo muy respetado y querido por su puntualidad y apoyo. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra una congeladora con exhibidor, donde pondrá la carne de pollo para su mejor conservación, ya que en la refrigeradora que él tiene no puede mostrar su producto para atraer a más clientela.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 59 years old, lives alone and is separeated from his wife, with whom he has 3 children: Martha, 32, Robert, 28 and Mario, 26. They all have independent lives. For more than 32 years he has been selling chicken (meat). This has been very stable and tranquil, and, thanks to him, it keeps on going. He works from 8 in the morning to 5 or 6 in the afternoon in the market, where his stand is, thanks to his work. He sells the chicken in a short time, but it doesn't always keep its freshness. This is his worst problem. He must sell in the market with the given time, and happily he seldom has these problems and earns good profits. He has a neice who sometimes helps him, which makes the work easier. This is Lorenzo's second loan with MFP. He is the only man in the group and is very respected and liked for his punctuality and support. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of a freezer with a window where he can put the meat to improve conservation. The refrigerator that he has can't display his product in order to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una congeladora

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señorita Norma López de 44 años vive en la casa de sus padres a quien le cuida y se hace responsable de ellos ya que son adultos.

La señorita Norma empezó el negocio hace 4 años con un capital que consiguió trabajando en el exterior donde estuvo trabajando por 4 años , empezó con una mercería y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.

El sueño de Norma es que su negocio crezca cada día y con eso aumentar sus ingresos mensuales, para que el día de mañana pueda llevar una vida más cómoda.

Solicita estos préstamos para compra de mercaderías como pantalón vaqueros, remeras, championes, carteras, conjuntos de buzos, camisa, desodorantes, ropa interior,  bijouteri, zapatillas, perfumes en general. Así aumentará su stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
Norma López is 44 years old. She lives in her parents' home, where she cares for them now that they are elderly. Norma started her business 4 years ago with capital that that she had made while working abroad for 4 years. She began with a notions shop and over time she converted it in a clothing shop. Norma's dream is for her business to grow each day and to increase her monthly earnings, so that she can have a more comfortable life in the future. She is requesting these loans for the purchase of merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, wallets, sweatsuits, shirts, deodorant, underwear, jewelry, slippers, and perfume. With this she will increase her stock of merchandise and offer greater selection to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of men’s and women’s jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, wallets, deodorant, underwear, jewelry, slippers, and perfume

loans.name: Safia Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Sheedan baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (pipes and taps) to resell. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Noor baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Safia baji, the wife of A. R., resides in a historical place in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, named Yadgar. She is the group leader of the above mentioned ladies. These ladies all have a good nature and give respect to each other. Safia baji's husband has a construction-supply business. Presently, he is out of stock and Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies (sand and cement) to complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to resell

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: Doña Teresa tiene 45 años de edad, reside en le barrio La Luz en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en jardinería en un  hotel de la capital Crown plaza, tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad. La señora Teresa trabaja de conserje desde hace ocho años en una empresa privada. Con esta solicitud de crédito quiere hacer un muro en frente de su casa para luego comenzar a hacer las paredes de concreto ya que su humilde casa es de tabla ya muy viaja y necesita remodelarla. Sus planes es seguir mejorando su vivienda para tener una casa digna para su familia. Da las gracias  Afodenic por el beneficio que lograra para tener mejor seguridad en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is 45 years of age and lives in the La Luz neighborhood of the capital, Managua. Her husband works at gardening for the Crown Plaza Hotel. She has five adult children. Señora Teresa has worked for eight years as a receptionist for a private business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to make a wall in front of her house so she can quickly begin building walls of concrete for her house. Her humble house is made of very old boards and she needs to remodel it. Her plans are to continue fixing up her home in order to have a dignified house for her family. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the assistance she will receive in order to have better security in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sulu

texts.en:
Sulu M., 38, is married with four children. She has three years of experience in her handicrafts business. She sells to the general public and to tourists three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Sulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her business is operating well.

loans.use: To purchase an electric chainsaw, a chisel set and sandpaper

loans.name: Nekhe Derete Group

texts.fr: NEKHE DERETE est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes.
texts.en:
NEKHE DERETE is a group of women who live near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. They are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, the group members are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they wait for harvest time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mr. C., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Mach Reun, age 51, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment factory workers and another one is in school.

C. and his wife have been selling fish for three years. They buy fish from a fishing lot and fishermen, and then  resell the fish in the village where they live and at the market in Phnom Penh. He is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike. He will also use his loan to expand his fish business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and expand his fish business.

loans.name: Solinda

texts.es: Solinda tiene 42 años, vive con sus hijos: Eduardo de 20, Miguel de 19 y Fiorela de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la administración de su negocio, ella cuenta con un auto para el que contrata un chofer que realiza el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y cada día rinde las ganancias con Solinda. Ella nos cuenta que anteriormente tenía una tienda de productos comestibles, pero a causa de que uno de sus hijos iba a postular a la marina vendió todo para su preparación; posteriormente, él, con las ganancias de su trabajo ayudó a su madre a comprar el auto. Solinda se siente feliz con su trabajo, ya que le resulta rentable, además puede ofrecerle trabajo a otra persona y brindarles a sus hijos menores un mejor porvenir. Para el futuro quiere adquirir otro carro para que lo maneje uno de sus hijos, quien también está deseoso de ponerse a trabajar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, anteriormente trabajó con bancos comunales, pero le resulta más cómodo sacar un préstamo individual, ya que no dispone de mucho tiempo libre. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en pago de revisión técnica de su vehiculo, además quiere convertirlo a uso de gas y darle una capa de pintura.
texts.en:
Solinda is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her children: Eduardo who is 20, Miguel who is 19, and Fiorela who is 12. For 2 years she has managed her own business. She owns a car and hires a driver to provide transportation services to passengers and which every day yields profits. She tells us that earlier she had a grocery store, but because one of her sons was thinking about joining the navy, she sold the store to pay for all of his preparations. Afterwards, he, with his earnings, helped his mother to buy the car. Solinda feels happy with her job, that is already profitable and can also provide work to another person and offers his small children a better future. In the future, she wants to acquire another car for one of her sons to drive, who are also eager to work. This is her fourth loan with MFP. Earlier she worked with communal banks, but it turns out that she is more comfortable to take out an individual loan because she does not have much free time. The money she is asking for will be invested in mechanical repairs for the car as well as a new coat of paint and will also be used for gas.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: auto maintenance

loans.name: Mayanapa Group

texts.es:
Ernestina N. de 70 años trabaja con Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 4 años, su comadre la habìa invitado a formar parte del grupo “Mayanapa” que a su vez pertence al Centro Focal “Collpani”. Ella tiene 4 hijos todos casados y cuida de sus dos nietas que son huérfanas, su actividad económica es vender  jugos (plátano, papaya, zanahoria) en diferentes ferias, trae su mercaderia de los tambos (lugar donde se compra fruta al por mayor), ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar sumidora y licuadora.  A Ernestina le gusta participar de las reuniones porque se distrae y comparte con sus compañeras. 
Las demás integrantes de Mayanapa tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de calzados, chompas, comida, colchas y necesitan el préstamo para comprar  mercaderia.

loans.use: COMPRA DE HERRAMIENTAS Y MERCADERIA

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 44 years old and married to Evelyn, his business partner. They live in Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela, and are blessed with ten children. Nehemiah and Evelyn help each other to support their large family. Nehemiah manages a buy and sell vegetable business, and does his best to meet his family's needs through the income he generates from the business. Due to the growing needs of their family, Nehemiah noted that he needed to double his income. To have additional capital, Nehemiah is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to improve his business and eventually increase his daily income.

Nehemiah has a strong determination to fulfill his dreams in life. He wants to be able to improve his family's poor way of living by improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Goog Luck is a group of 5 borrowers led by Prince T.. Prince is 26 years old, a single father of a 3-year-old child in the kindergarten 2 level. 

He is an 11th grade student who depends on business to cater for he and his child.

Peter and his child lives in Molton Corner, north of the outskirts of the capital city, Monrovia, Liberia.

Pater’s business is his center. He owns a call center where he does pay calls, sells mobile phones recharge call cards, and exchange of foreign currencies like United States Dollars and Cefa to residents of Molton Corner.

Peter has been running his business for 2 years and hoping to establish a big foreign exchange bureau in down town Monrovia, Liberia.
He sometimes faces low recharge call card problems that make business bad for him.
Peter needs this loan in order to add up and buy more recharge call card to improve business.
He dreams of giving his child a better education and to prepare him for the future to come.

loans.use: Peter needs this loan in order to add up and buy more recharge call card to improve business.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia  C.  est  âgée de 40 ans, elle est mère d’un enfant et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son  époux et son enfant  dans le quartier  Lafiabougou  de la ville de  San, région de Ségou (quatrième région de administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas  eu la chance de faire de longue étude, elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge  qu’elle a appris d’elle même  sur le tas.  De nos jours  elle excelle  dans   la vente des produits de beauté, qu’elle embrassa  il y a 10 ans. 
C’est dans le but  d’augmenter son capital que Madame Rokia a fait recours  à Soro Yiriwaso  il  y ‘a   5 ans. 
Après  5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous payés correctement, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Avec ce prêt elle compte, acheter un important stock de marchandises à Bamako et au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au grand marché de San dans sa boutique,  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Ces ventes se font  essentiellement au comptant. 
Avec  l’augmentation de son fond de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice  de 130 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera comme suit : une partie pour le remboursement du prêt,  l’autre  partie pour les petites dépenses de famille et  investir  le reste dans son entreprise. 
Madame Rokia espère solliciter un financement plus important pour  lui permettre d’ouvrir une deuxième  boutique pour son  fils à San.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokia C. is 40 years old and the mother of a child.  She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and child in the Lafiabougou district of the city of San, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).  Not having had the chance to attend school for long, she became interested at a young age in revenue-generating work, which she learned-by-doing on her own.  These days, she excels in selling beauty products, which she embraced ten years ago. With the goal of increasing her capital, Ms. Rokia turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago.  After five solidarity loans (group loans), all properly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan.  With this loan, she intends to purchase a major stock of merchandise in Bamako and in Burkina Faso and to make sales in her shop at the big market of San.  Her customers are composed of women and men.  These sales are essentially made in cash.   With the increase in her business capital, she plans on a profit of 130,000 francs CFA per month that she will use as follows:  a portion for repaying the loan, the other portion for sundry family expenses, and the remainder for investing in her enterprise.   She hopes to apply for larger loans enabling her to open a second shop for her son, in San.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun S. lives in Pour Ta Mouk Village in Takeo Province. She breeds ducks and sells duck eggs in the local market. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 750 more ducklings and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. Heam Phorn, grows rice on a plot of land that he owns. He is also a fisherman. Mrs. Samoeun S. is 36 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children is a farmer, another child attends the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy 750 more ducklings and duck food

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is being taken out by 18 people who all live in Trapeang Trakiet village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sam H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is facing an obstacle of being unable to water her crops because her water pump needs to be repaired. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to fix her pump so that she can water the field and make the crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Phat, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Sam H. is a mother of two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is studying at home and doing house work.

loans.use: To fix her pump in order to water the field and make the crops more productive

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARGOT tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es natural D. la ciudad D. Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. comida. La socia tiene un restaurante “El Ciencianito” (Cienciano equipo D. fútbol representativo D. la ciudad del Cusco) donD. venD. caldos D. cabeza, adobos y comida típica D. la región. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. venta D. comida desea comprar insumos como papas, arroz, fideos, carne y verduras.            
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margot is 48 years old, married and has two children. She is a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Cusco," which is part of the Arariwa Association. She alternates her activities in the home with the sale of food. She has a restaurant called “El Ciencianito” (Ciencianito is Cusco's soccer team), where she sells head broth, marinated meat and other food that is typical of the region. She has had this business for a number of years, and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. Margot is very enterprising and hardworking because she wants to advance her family economically. She needs a loan to increase her working capital for her business; she wants to buy supplies such as potatoes, rice, noodles, meat and vegetables. Margot is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as potatoes, rice, noodles, meat and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia D. R. de 49 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Emilia es madre soltera, la cual se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar mucho por sus hijos, a pesar que ha sido muy difícil para ella, ha logrado seguir adelantes y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos como alimentación, vestuario y estudios. Emilia posee una venta de queso, la cual comercializa de manera ambulante en su bicicleta, ella va por las calles de Puerto del Triunfo ofreciendo el queso el cual le ha permitido durante muchos años sostener a su familia. Es por esto que Emilia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración del queso y así poder brindar mayor producto. Emilia es una mujer la cual es muy admirada en su colonia, ya que es alguien quien inspira a seguir adelante y a esforzarse cada día más.
texts.en:
Emilia D. R. is 49 years old and is a resident of Puerto el Triunfo in the department of Usulután. She is a single mother and lives with her three children who are completely dependent on her. Although it is difficult her, Emilia works hard to provide for her children and give them the basic necessities of food, clothing, and an education. She sells cheese as a traveling merchant, riding her bike through the streets of Puerto el Triunfo. Emilia has been been in this business for several years, and it has enabled her to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials for making cheese so that she can produce a better product. Emilia is well-respected in her neighborhood since she inspires others to strive for success each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making cheese

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Neila Rosa

texts.es:
Neila E. D. García tiene 69 años y siete hijos entre las edades D. 35 y 50 años. Vive en el   barrio Cachimbiro, cuna D. un antiguo  asentamiento D. indígenas  que usaban cachimbo,  una pipa en tagua y madera  elaborada por artistas naturales D. origen afrocolombianos.
A sus 69 años, es una mujer D. conversación graciosa y concurrente, que no deja D. trabajar porque siempre desea mejorar su casa con autonomía y comprar los muebles y electrodoméstico que por su uso constante hay que cambiar. Por eso  Neila elabora confecciones D. uniformes para enfermeras y ropa blanca, mediante contratos y trabaja sobre medidas, es decir sus clientes llevan la tela y ella toma las medidas e interpreta y diseña la moda solicitada D. acuerdo a como cada cual desee vestir.  
Neila tiene una máquina y debe mandar a filetear los vestidos,  inició nuevamente  su negocio hace cuatro años pues lo había suspendido por que la atención D. sus siete hijos y los excesos en  sus horarios deterioraron su salud; en su antiguo negocio cosía overoles y uniformes D. hombres  en volúmenes. Ahora con su esposo ya pensionado y sus hijos trabajando, realiza esta labor mas relajadamente, ella no quiere dejar D. coser pues conoce este arte desD. los 17 años, lo estudió en una academia D. modistería, cerca a su casa, antes D. casarse. 
Este es su segundo crédito que le permitió reiniciar su negocio con la ayuda D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conoció a esta organización a través D. la compañera D. trabajo D. su hija, una enfermera y ahora su codeudora.  Actualmente Solicita un crédito D. $2.000.000 para comprar una maquina fileteadora, que dará un mejor acabado a sus prendas y no tendrá que pagar mas por este servicio.
Su negocio  D. confecciones le permite apoyar los ingresos D. su hogar donD. vive con su esposo,    un pensionado D. Avianca y una hija soltera que le ayuda en  los ingresos al igual que sus otros hijos que ya no están con ella. Su meta es reemplazar muebles D. la casa y comprar unos buenos electrodomésticos, como una lavadora, estos ala ayudarà a hacer su dia a día más fácil y su ambiente doméstico agradable.
Neila vive una vida mas tranquila, ama a su familia y a su tierra Soledad reconocida nacionalmente por ser el cuna D. la butifarra, embutido D. Origen Catalan que es una D. las insignias culinarias D. la Costa Caribe que aun persiste.
texts.en:
Neila E. D. García is 69 years old and has seven children who range in age from 35 to 50. She lives in the neighborhood of Cachimbiro, which is an ancient indigenous settlement. This area is known for the use of the “cachimbo”, a tobacco pipe maD. of ivory and wood maD. by native artists of Afro-Colombian origin.

Neila is a gracious woman who enjoys conversation. At 69 years of age, she does not stop working because she wants to make improvements to her home on her own. She plans to purchase new furniture and appliances because her current items need to be replaced because of constant use. In order to earn money, Neila produces nurses’ uniforms and bed linens through contracts and by direct request. Her customers bring her the material and she takes measurements to determine the design of the uniform. She also takes into consideration how the person wants to dress.

Neila has a sewing machine, but she still has to send out dresses for overlock stitching (in order to finish the edges). She restarted this business four years ago. Neila had stopped working in order to take care of her seven children and also her excessive schedule took a toll on her health. In her previous business, she manufactured overalls and men’s uniforms in mass quantity. Now that her husband is retired and her children are working, Neila is more relaxed when she works. She has no plans to quit because she has been sewing since she was 17 years old. Prior to getting married, she studied dressmaking at an academy near her home.

With this second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Neila will be able to restart her business. She learned about the organization from a co-worker of her daughter, who is a nurse and the co-signer of this loan. The proceeds in the amount of 2,000,000 COP will be used to buy an overlock stitching machine, which will allow her to finish the seams of her garments without having to pay extra for this service.

The income generated from Neila’s apparel business enables her to maintain the home where she lives with her husband, who is a pensioner of Avianca (the national airline of Colombia). One of her unmarried daughters also lives with them and helps with the expenses. Her other children contribute as well. In addition to replacing the furniture, Neila wants to buy some durable appliances, such as a washing machine, that will make her daily chores easier and her home more pleasant. Neila has a very peaceful life. She loves her family and her hometown of Soledad, which is nationally recognized for being the birthplace of “butifarra”, a sausage of Catalan origin that is a specialty of Caribbean coastal cuisine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an overlock stitching machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en: Eusebio P. Jr. is from Valencia City. He is 53 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Eusebio owns and operates a business providing a boarding house for rent in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eusebio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Eusebio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Excel

texts.en: Excel A. owns and operates a specialized retail business selling electronic load in his community. He is 38 years old, married and has two school-age children. He is from the village of Brgy. 17, Gingoog City. Excel has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Excel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Excel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his third loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Queen

texts.en: Mary Queen D. operates a family member's business raising pigs for sale. She is a 20-year-old single woman from from the village of Boundary, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her photo was taken during loan release in the center house. Mary Queen has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Mary Queen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to save in reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Joven Luis de  27 años de edad es soltero, trabaja como docente desde hace 11 años en el Ministerio de Educaciòn, vive con su mamà pues aun no formado su propio hogar, es un hombre bien responsable ya que cuida de su madre y la ayuda con los gastos familiares pues son  personas de escasos recursos econòmicos y dependen economicamente de la siembra de raices y tuberculos y del salario que el devenga como maestro.

Està solicitando su 4to crèdito con el cual pretende cambiarle el zinc a la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y asi cuando venga el invierno estar preparado.

Espera seguir siendo beneficiada por AFODENIC ya que es una instituciòn que le otorga  crèditos a personas de escasos recursos econòmicos . su sueño en el futuro es que su familia tengan mucha salud y trabajo para seguir ayudandolos.
texts.en:
Luis, 27, is single and has been employed by the Ministry of Education as a teacher for 11 years. He lives with his mother because he hasn’t formed his own family yet. He is a responsible young man who cares for his mother and helps her with household expenses because they are a low-income family that depends on whatever income they make from farming tubers and root vegetables and his teacher’s salary. He is asking for his 4th loan which he will use to replace the zinc metal roofing on the house because it’s in bad shape and he wants to be prepared for winter. He hopes to continue to receive benefits from AFODENIC because it’s an institution that grants loans to low-income persons. His dream for the future is that his family be very healthy and that he can continue to have employment so that he can continue to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace zinc metal roofing.

loans.name: Darmalatha

texts.en:
Darmalatha is a 48-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle with her husband and two children.  Darmalatha and her husband have been managing the business (which consists of cultivating a cinnamon garden) by themselves.  She devotes her full efforts towards cultivating her cinnamon garden, step by step, and uses the income to help support herself.  

She has managed her business for five years now with her husband. In her business, she works hard and enjoys the benefits of favorable weather for cinnamon gardening and high quality land for cultivating.  

Darmalatha has asked for a 30,000-rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her cinnamon garden.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for the cinnamon garden.

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there with her family for over twenty years. Her husband's name is M. I. and he runs a sanitary shop in the market. He has been in this profession for seven years.  


To increases their family income, Hamidan makes embroidered dresses to order. She receives orders from the cloth shops and completes a dress in a day, making Pak Rs. 500 profit on it. They both use their income to pay for utilities and to save for a rainy day.

 
Hamidan is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase, in bulk, sanitary supplies such as taps and water pipes and increase the profits of his business.

loans.use: to purchase sanitary supplies in bulk to sell

loans.name: Suld

texts.en: Suld S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife in a traditional tent (known as a ger) in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. His wife helps him in his work, which consists of making jewelry from recycled materials such as plastic bottles and glass. He takes his output to Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, and sells his items there. Suld is a modest and hard-working person who very much wants to enlarge his business. He has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to increase his output by buying more raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia D. is a 49-year old married woman who lives in Barangay Balidbid, Santa Fe, Cebu City. She earns her living by engaging in a dress shop and tailoring business.

Pacencia’s 56 year old husband, Jose, helps his wife with the business and they have 6 children who are between 9-28 years old. Four of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. One is already married while the other one is working and helping Pacencia.

Pacencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a clothes rental business and her tailoring. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Pacencia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 was used to fund operations of her dress shop and tailoring business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 29,500, which she intends to use on her dress shop and tailoring business. Pacencia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural del distrito de Pomalca, sus principales actividades son la agricultura, la ganadería y la artesanía.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la comercialización de productos de uso diario en una pequeña bodega instalada dentro de su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos algunos productos de primera necesidad que son dificiles de adquirir por la zona, esto le ha permitido obtener un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su establecimiento. Adicionalmente cría animales menores, los cuales ofrece en venta a sus vecinos. Con estos ingresos ella ayuda a su esposo, que trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de ladrillos, a sostener la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes, de modo que pueda implementar su negocio y ampliar sus ventas, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer de trato amable y servicial, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe, 28, is a mother who lives with her husband and three children in the San Pablo sector, a rural area of Pomalca district. Her main economic activity is farming, cattle raising and handicrafts. For the last year she has had a grocery store set up in her home. She offers her neighbors basic need items that are hard to find in her area. This has brought her regular customers that always come to her store. In addition, she raises small farm animals to sell to her neighbors. Income she earns helps her husband, who is employed as a laborer in a brick factory, to support the family. María would like to expand her business buying more groceries so that a greater variety of stock will produce higher sales. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 500 new sol loan. María is a kind and helpful woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard and respect.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
