He graduated from the Agricultural Institute and, having worked for 15 years, gained a reputation of a goal-oriented and persistent person.  In 2000, using a starting sum of 50,000 som (KGS), Rysbek opened his own store, where he sells auto parts.   Today, his store is known among motorists for its quality goods and affordable prices.  In order to further expand his business, Rysbek requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to broaden his merchandise selection.  This would let him increase goods turnover and attract new customers.  In the duture, Rysbek dreams of buying a new car.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her family business of selling animals (goats).  
She is a multi-business owner. She also sews clothes for her neighbors. With the loan, she will buy animals like goats to sell to butchers after raising them. 
Her husband also has an animal sales business. Both Khursheed and her husband started this business 15 years ago and now have a vast knowledge in their field of work. 
She has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide an education for their children. All of them stay at home and provide support to their parents in their businesses. 
Khursheed is very confident that, after the loan investment, she will be able to increase her profits and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for her animal sales business

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muungano Group in Western Kenya! Esnas is the facilitator of the Muungano group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Esnas takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esnas had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esnas was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esnas and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Esnas will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant  between 3/4 and 1 acre of maize.

Esnas is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 2 est un  groupement composé de seize personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupement  du nom de Bernadette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bernadette est âgée de 53 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Bernadette  est une veuve ayant deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un n’est plus à sa charge. Bernadette vit avec l’enfant qui lui reste à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges. Bernadette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Bernadette  vend des tissus de différentes sortes par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de l’enfant à charge. Bernadette  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Bernadette  et aux autres membres du groupement NONVIGNON 2, de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON 2 is a group made up of sixteen people all living in the same neighborhood in Benin.  This is the second time that the group has requested a loan through ALIDé, in order to increase their business activity and better respond to their customers' needs.  The group representative, named Bernadette, has her hand raised in the photo.  Bernadette is 53 years old and lives in a city in Benin.  She is a widow with two children, both of whom have had an education, and one of whom is still under her care.  Bernadette lives with the child still under her care and pays for all his expenses.

Bernadette had very little formal education.  For about twenty years, she has been selling different types of fabric through a distribution system.  This business has helped her to meet her expenses and those of the child still under her care.  Bernadette buys her stock in a market in Benin.  This loan will help her and other members of the NONVIGNON 2 group to grow their businesses and increase their profits and income.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is working hard to meet the needs of her family. She is 33 years old and married, having only one child. Her husband is her helper in improving their corn fields to be more productive. Mary Ann has been managing her corn field for almost 18 years. From the long period of time she has spent working in her corn field, she noticed that the price of farm supplies is increasing, so her funds are no longer enough to purchase farm supplies. Mary Ann decided to join the program of a lending institution where she could borrow additional capital to provide the supplies for her corn field.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan of P27,000 to be used in buying farm supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, certified seeds and for labor costs for planting and plowing the corn field. She is hoping that her request loan will be granted to make her corn field more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, certified seeds, pesticides and pay labor costs for planting and plowing the corn field.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 26 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Fel, su esposo desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas: Deysi y Evelin a las que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Huaytacorral. Ella vive en una mujer humilde, con su esfuerzo pudo adquirir una casa, donde construyó con material rústico. Ahora desea mejorar su calidad de vida pazo a pazo. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, con la siembra de papa y maca en grandes cantidades, gracias a su esfuerzo, pudo adquirir 4 hectáreas de terreno productivo, donde todos los días cuida con esmero, pues es su único sustento. Además de las 30 ovejas y 2 cerdos que cría para luego venderlos cuando están gordos a los carniceros que visitan la feria de Acostambo los días viernes donde baja a negociar. Por el momento desea ahorrar lo suficiente para poder lograr su principal objetivo. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Sonia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en mejorar el techo de su casa con un material más resistente.
texts.en:
Sonia, 26, is a hard-working woman who has lived with her husband, Fel, for two years. They have 2 daughters, Deysi and Evelin, and live in their own house, located in the village of Huaytacorral.  She is a humble woman and with her effort, has been able to acquire a house which was built of rustic material.  She wants to improve the quality of her life, little by little.  She is mainly a farmer and grows potatoes and maca (a root that is supposed to be very healthy-often sold in powder) in big quantities.  Thanks to her effort she was able to get 4 hectares of productive fields and she tends to them carefully every day since they are her main income.  Also she is raising 30 sheep and 2 pigs and when they are fattened, she will sell them  to the butchers who come to the market in Acostambo on Fridays where she goes to sell.  

Right now her wish is to save up enough to be able to fulfill her main goal.  This is the sixth loan with MFP where she is waiting for their help to finalize her plans.  She promises to make all her payments on time.  She is happy to be part of the association because the members are responsible and united.  Sonia will use the requested money to improve the roof on her house with more resistant material.

loans.use: to improve the roof on her house

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 54 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 
Rufina works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fish to sell for her fish vending business. 
Rufina has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business in the town.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
Desde hace más de 30 años Raúl se dedica a la venta de mercancía, yendo de pueblo en pueblo vendiendo ropa, accesorios, confites entre otros productos de venta masiva que hacen que donde llegue llame la atención inmediatamente. Utilizando un megáfono hace perifoneo y los clientes se acercan de manera espontánea donde aprovecha para venderles los productos con un estilo jocoso y único por su gran personalidad. 

El crédito lo utilizará para poder comprar más mercancía ya que quiere ir a otros pueblos y municipios y abrir otros mercados. Uno de sus sueños es poder comprar mucho más adelante un carro con el cual pueda cargar más producto y no demorarse tanto en los recorridos entre los pueblos. 

Su familia es su más grande apoyo y por eso este gran ciudadano y emprendedor se esforzará por cumplir con todos los requerimientos que le soliciten sus clientes.
texts.en:
Raúl has been selling merchandise for more than 30 years.  He goes from town to town selling clothes, accessories and sweets, among other products of mass consumption that attracts attention immediately upon his arrival anywhere.  He broadcasts using a megaphone and customers spontaneously approach and he sells to them in a unique, good-humored way that’s his personality.  

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise because he wants to go to other towns and municipalities to open up other markets.  One of his dreams is to be able to buy a car much later on so that he can load more merchandise and not take so long getting from town to town.  His family is his greatest support system and this is why this great and enterprising citizen will strive to meet all the requirements his customers request.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Xai-Xai , Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, Viuvo e pai de 12 filhos dos quais 7 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez ensino Superior e parou por falta de tempo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Xai-Xai para Maputo em missão de serviço onde fixou a sua residência no Distrito de Boane. É tecnico agrario ha mais de 32 anos na Estação Agraria de Umbeluzi e tem um salario de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos (Barclays) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (barrotes, pedra, cimento, blocos, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 30.000.00mt, tambem para mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Xai-Xai, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is a widower and has 12 children, 7 of which still attend school. He went to college and quit for lack of time. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He got transferred from Xai-Xai to Maputo on a work assignment and set up residence in the district of Boane. He has been a land surveyor for the Umbeluzi Rural Station for over 32 years and earns a salary of 11.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has had loans in other banks (Barclays) and managed to repay without difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 24.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his home (rafters, stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 30.000mt, also for the same purpose.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he plans to finish building his house in order to provide more comfort for his family. For that reason he intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for his home (rafters, stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en pareja con la Sra. Liduvina hace más de 8 años, tienen 2 hijos juntos, todos van a la escuela aun. El nos comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, en lo cual le va bien.
Blás cuenta que como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió trabajar en agricultura, y luego de juntar para su capital empezó en la venta de artesanía por zonas de la capital. Sus recorridos primeramente los hacía a pie y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela. Blás es un señor muy sacrificado pues tiene que recorrer casa por casa y varios kilómetros en su motocicleta.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Blas, 39, lives in the city of Carapeguá with his common-law wife of eight years, Liduvina, and their two children who are in school.  He is a street vendor and sells all kinds of products, and business is going well.

Blas says he comes from a modest family and because he wanted to get ahead began working in agriculture.  Once he made enough money he began selling crafts in different areas of the city.  He used to have to walk to sell but through his work and effort was able to buy a motorcycle that he uses for sales and to keep his best customers.  Blas is a very self-sacrificing man who must travel many kilometers on his motorcycle to go door to door.

He plans to use the loan to buy hammocks, waistbands and sheets because he has many orders for these products.

loans.use: To buy hammocks, waistbands and sheets.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 44 years old and married with six children. For the past ten years she has had a shop where she sells dry goods such as blouses, shirts and sandals. 

Mona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more dry goods to sell. With her anticipated profits Mona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Oyunsuvdiin Buleg Group

texts.en:
Oyunsuvd is a-30-year-old lady who lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her felt manufacturing business in 2004. She makes felt sandals, felt souvenirs and other products which tourists traveling in Mongolia are interested in buying. In July, Mongolians have the great holiday Naadam, so during this holiday a lot of tourists come to Mongolia. Thus she needs to make more felt products.

Oyunsuvd is requesting a Kiva loan with Transcapital NBFI from Mongolia. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials in order to make more felt products and increase her income during the Naadam holiday.  This loan is their second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more felt to make more products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35 year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and with the proceeds, she has been able to earn a living and pay school fees for her children. Apart from that, she also practices farming plus mobile money services, from which she earns money to support her family.
She hopes to educate all her children to a minimum qualification of a degree though she is challenged by delays in payments by customers who buy on credit from her.

She needs money to buy more bread, cooking oil and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more bread, cooking oil and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon started by selling of chicken in the market. After doing this business for two years, he got some more money to venture into more paying business.  He started selling goats in the village markets.
 
He got a loan money of $200 and this expanded his business to selling cows in the local markets around.
 
He can now afford to buy up to 3 bulls of 300,000 shillings each.
Given a loan of $1000, he plans to expand his business by buying up to 15 Bulls that can fetch him enough profit to meet his basic needs and pay the loan money.
 
Uganda being a rainy country, cows have enough grass to feed on freely.
 
Simon is a respected a man in the community who is able to refund the loan money.

loans.use: Buying livestock

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Joining the program in 2004 helped Elenoa contribute to the family earnings where as before being a part of the program her husband was the sole breadwinner who earned less than 100 tala (US$40) a week. A mother of five with four attending school in the village Elenoa’s first loan was $750 tala. This funding was used to purchase a fishing boat/alia including fishing equipment to start off the business. Soon after the business started her husband left his job to operate the fishing boat and now the business earns the family $360 (US$144) from selling an average of three strings per day for four days. Elenoa recently reapplied for her next loan which will help her purchase a new fishing net and partially renovate the family's house.

loans.use: To purchase a new fishing net for the family's fishing boat and to partially improve their house.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Mintah is a resident of this town and operates a general goods shop in which she sells various items. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $850.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 45 years old. She has 3 children between 16 and 11 years of age. Her husband left her for another woman. Mrs Lan is supporting all her children by herself. The family’s situation is very difficult, so her first son stopped going to school early. Her second and third are going to school in grades 8 and 6.

Lan doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Lan buys material waste form door to door and then she sells it at the local recycling company. This work increased her family income by about $2/person/month. Now Lan wants to borrow $75 to buy more recyclable material.

loans.use: Buy material waste for recycling

loans.name: Musharafhon

texts.ru:
Musharafhon S. is 50 years old, is a widow and has a son. She has a college education. Her son sells flatbread. After her husband passed away, it was up to her to take care of the family. She took care of raising her son and making sure that he has a good education. She has been selling soap, shampoo and dish soap for the past 7 years. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2004. The loan allowed her to secure a bigger and better sales point location as well as double her turnover. Currently her assets amount to $600. She is planing to open another sales point.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

Шукурова Мушарафхон – 50лет, вдова, имеет одного сына. Образование высшее. Сын занимается продажей лепешек. После смерти мужа все заботы о семье легли на её голову, она одна растила сына, дала ему образование. Занимается продажей мыла, шампуня и средства для мытья посуды 7лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2004году. После получения займа и целевого использования она расширила и улучшила место для деятельности, увеличила товарооборот в два раза. Сейчас её активы возросли до 600$. На будущее она планирует приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another sales point

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victor Hernan. My main activity is passenger transportation, I owe a taxi with the official number 247, I have been dedicated to this activity for several years in my hometown and my income is enough to cover my family expenses and other obligations.

Currently I need to purchase some spare parts for the vehicle in order to offer better service to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Victor Hernan, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajero, cuento con un taxi operando bajo el No. 247 en mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos.

Actualmente necesito comprar algunos repuestos para el vehiculo y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio al usuario.

loans.use: To purchase tyres, blankets, buffers, water pump, fan, and combustion pump.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella E. is a 49-year-old married woman who has 7. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. Stella sells children's wear. This is a business she started in 2000. She is in need of $400 to enable her buy more baby things and female wear for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby things and female wear for sale

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. looks after 6 orphans and one old woman with goiter disease. She wants a loan to increase her capital so that she can increase her stock of charcoal and increase her sales and profits. She needs extra profits to pay school fees for the orphans.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is married with 7 children.  She has been selling palm oil for five years and the income goes mainly to meeting the family’s expenses.  Her husband has irregular income and could not cope with up keep.  “To feed 7 children and provide them with education is not an easy thing to do,” said Kadiatu.  She needs to work hard to make ends meet.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000.

loans.use: Kadiatu needs to increase her stock of palm oil so that she can generate additional income to help her care for her children.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou S., 40, has worked in construction since 2005, making an average of $3 a day. To supplement the household income, her husband, Mr. Nghik Hon, 41, also works in construction and normally earns $3 a day. They have three children, two of whom are laborers with incomes of $2 a day and one who is a student. To decrease the cost of commuting, this couple asks for a loan of $500 to purchase a motor-bike. (Her husband is pictured with the type of motor-bike that he and his wife are planning to buy for their transportation).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to decrease the cost of commuting.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun V. is 40 years old and raises pigs. Living in Beng Village in the Siem Reap Province, she earns $0.83 per day. Her husband, Mr. Khan Chan (he is pictured), is a 42-year-old fisherman with an income of about $1.50 per day. They have three children, two of whom work part-time to support their family by selling fish and harvesting rice. Because of increasing family expenses, they need more money and hope to generate additional income.  To this end, they request a loan of $250 to purchase cows to raise and sell their offspring.

loans.use: To purchase cows and raise and sell their offspring

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. G. manufactures milk products in Moche, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  These products include yogurt, creamsickles, and candies but she plans on offering more in the future.  She started the business 2 years ago after working in the dairy industry for most of her life.  She owns some cows and sold milk to the local dairy but now earns far more with her new business.

Elizabeth is 44 years old, married with 4 children.  She loves building relationships, discovering creative new products and working with her family.  Her husband is very supportive and they are excited about their future.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adelante II, Elizabeth is requesting of loan of $300 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients and molds to make yogurt.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and molds to make yogurt.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities, which she then sells to her customers in smaller quantities. She is divorced and has 2 children. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a major problem.

Esther is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, allowing her to buy more food supplies per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang C., 47, is the mother of six children and sells fruits and groceries in front of her house. She makes about $3.70 each day. Her husband has been a farmer since 1980 and normally he earns $2 a day. One child is married and lives away from home; two are garment workers; and two are students. To meet her high demand of selling fruits and groceries, she would like a loan to add more stuff to sell. The left over money will be used to buy wood to repair her leaking roof.

loans.use: Eang would like to add more groceries and fruits for sale at her home.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a perservering woman with a fortitude that does not allow her to get knocked down by financial problems. She opened up a path for herself little by little, starting with two rams and using the earnings from her first sale to buy some pigs and later some cows and bulls. She buys these animals at a low price and resells them for more, generating a profit that is the sole means of income for her household. For the moment she will continue doing business in this manner, however she hopes to be able to have a livestock stable in the future. Victoria wants to see her children become professionals, which is the reason she is asking for a loan to purchase a higher quality cow that she can then sell for a profit. Help support Victoria continue to perform well in her endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es una mujer constante y de mucha fortaleza para no dejarse abatir por los problemas económicos, se abrió paso poco a poco, primero comenzó con 2 carneros, luego con la ganancia que obtuvo de su primera venta de estos carneros pudo comprar cerdos, después vacas y toretes. Ella compra estos animales a un menor precio y los revende a uno mayor, de esta manera obtiene las ganancias que le permiten ser el único sostén de su casa, por el momento ella seguirá trabajando de este modo, pero más adelante su deseo es tener un establo de vacas. Victoria quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello que solicita un préstamo, con el cual comprará una vaca de mayor calidad para revenderla a mayor precio. Apoya a Victoria a seguir desempeñándose hábilmente en su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase a high-quality cow to sell for income.

loans.name: Ablossi

texts.fr:
Née en 195ent à T0 à Atsansi-Todomé dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame D. Ablossi vit actuellemékponou dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. La vente de produits médicinaux demeure son domaine d’exercice et avec ça elle arrive à subvenir à ses besoins.

Ainsi, elle fait des stockages de produits en temps d’abondance pour revendre en temps de cherté. Mais face à cette activité, elle manque cruellement d’argent. 

Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit. Ceci lui permettra  d’améliorer son revenu et son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1950 in Atsansi-Todomé in Vo Prefecture, Mrs. Ablossi D. presently still lives in Vo Prefecture. She is married and the mother of 7 children. The sale of medicinal products has remained her sphere of business and allows her to support herself.

Thus, she stocks up on products when they are abundant and sells them when they are expensive. But this activity leaves her cruelly lacking in funds.

She is therefore asking for a loan. This will permit her to improve her earnings and her living standard.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling medicinal products

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aves Fénix”, ubicado en Jr: Huancavelica Nº 146, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 73 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, vive con su nieta y con su hijo mayor, el cual trabaja como contador en el Concejo D. Pampa Hermosa. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas.

En la actualidad, Esther cuenta con la venta D. pasamanería (lapiceros, cinta D. embalaje, papel bond, fólder manila, correctores, etc.).

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, y con el apoyo D. su hijo, invertirá en la compra D. 4 cajas D. lapiceros, 3 cajas D. correctores, papel bond, 2 cajas D. borradores, etc.
   
Esther es una mujer alegre y manifiesta que gracias al banco comunal D. Manuela Ramos y a Dios el negocio ha mejorado y considera ser una persona totalmente feliz.
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the Communal Bank “"Las Aves Fénix," located at Jr: Huancavelica Nº 146, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 73 years old, mother to 5 grown children, she lives with her granddaughter and oldest son, who works as an accountant in the Pampa Hermosa Council. With the first loan that he received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 soles, he decided to invest in selling candy. Today, Esther sells supplies (pens, packaging tape, bond paper, manila folders, erasers, etc.). With this loan for S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, and with the support of her son, she will invest in buying 4 boxes of pens, 3 boxes of markers, bond paper, 2 boxes of erasers, etc. Esther is a happy woman and expresses her thanks to the Communal Bank of Manuela Ramos and God that her business has improved and she considers herself to be a totally happy person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pens, markers, bond paper, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia tiene 38 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah, es casada y con tres hermosos hijos de 4,9 y 12 años de edad quienes cursan la primaria, su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña Silvia es la venta de helados en su casa también lava y plancha a domicilio, ya tiene cuatro años de estar trabajando así y de esta manera aporta a los gastos de su hogar. La solicitud de este préstamo es para infraestructura en la reparación del techo de uno de los cuartos ya que está en mal estado, y con las lluvia se le hace muy difícil esta situación, también desea construir un muro en frente de la casa para poder tener un poco mas de seguridad para su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener una pulpería surtida donde pueda generar mas capital, para tener un negocio sólido en donde pueda cubrir sus necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Silvia is 38 years old and she lives in a neighborhood in the capital, Managua, which is called Hialeah. She is married and has 3 gorgeous kids who are 4, 9 and 12; they are in primary school. Her husband works and takes care of the household costs. Silvia works selling ice creams from her house, and she also washes and irons clothes from home. She has been doing this for 4 years and in this way helps with the household costs. She would like this loan for infrastructure, to repair the roof in one of their rooms which is in a bad state, and the rain makes this situation very difficult. She also wants to build a wall in front of the house for a bit more security for the family. In the long term she would like to have a well stocked grocery store to generate more capital, so she can have a solid business which will cover her economic needs.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall and repair the roof/Construcción de muro y reparación de techo

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija de 2 años, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Hace 5 años atrás trabajaba en la ciudad de Lima, vino de visita a Pichanaki, se enamoro y se quedo. Y hace un año empezó a sembrar una chacra de plátanos, a la cual le falta un año mas o menos para que ya empiece a cosechar, mientras tanto está contrayendo su casa, con anhelos de poner una tienda de abarrotes y claro seguir con la agricultura, porque cuando empiece a cosechar le ira muy bien, ya que el plátano se cosecha cada 15 dias, por el momento no conoce dificultades todavía en la chacra, pero sí tiene muchos anhelos de crecer en su negocio. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero lo invertirá en sus cultivos, además de comprar mercaderías de acuerdo lo que le alcance para su próxima bodega, la cual aun esta en proceso de construcción.
texts.en:
Fredy is 23 years old, has a partner and 2 year old daughter, and lives in the home of his parents. 5 years ago he used to work in Lima – he came to Pichanaki for a visit, fell in love, and stayed. One year ago he began to plant a banana farm, he still needs one year, more or less, until he can begin to harvest. Meanwhile he is building his home with the goal of opening a grocery store and of course continue with agriculture, because when he begins harvesting things will go well for him as bananas are harvested every 15 days. Today he doesn’t yet have any difficulties on the farm, but he has many dreams of growing his business. This is his first loan with MFP. The money will be invested in his crops in addition he will buy merchandise for his store, which he is still in the process of constructing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his agricultural production in addition to buying merchandise for his future grocery store

loans.name: Tabaksneh Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed D., Ramatu K., Fatu K. and Isatu S.. They named their group "Tabakseneh," a Temne word for “Let’s be patient.” This will be their eighth loan from SMT. Previous loans have had meaningful effects in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Mohamed D. (right) is the leader of the group. Mohamed is forty-two years of age. He was born in Sanda, about thirty-seven miles from Makeni. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have two children, both of whom are in primary schools. Mohamed sells slippers.  He has been in the business for over twenty-two years. He and his wife sell the slippers together.

With this loan, Mohamed will be able to buy at least three and a half cartons of slippers (100 pairs of slippers are in a carton). He has to travel to Freetown to buy the slippers. Freetown is 390 miles round trip from Makeni. In Freetown, a carton will cost him Le 300,000. His travel fare to and from Freetown is Le 24,000 and a Le 2,500 delivery charge is added for each carton.

One of the greatest challenges Mohamed is facing in his business is the high cost of rent for the store he is using. He pays Le 2,600,000 per year. Apart from this, business for him is doing well and fine. The profit he gets from his business makes him a happy man. He will save until the day comes when he will be able to build a house for himeself and his family.

loans.use: To buy at least three and a half cartons of slippers

loans.name: Martha Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Martha Felicita  R. D. B. tiene 45 años, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la Avenida La Marina Mz 1 lote 19  Aurora Díaz I  en el Puerto Marítimo D. Salaverry D. la provincia D. Trujillo del departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudio Técnica Administrativa, se casó a los 21 años y tuvo una hija y un hijo, su niña falleció, dolor que gracias a su espíritu emprendedor ha ido superando.
Su negocio consiste en la venta D. bebidas lo realiza en su casa, también es distribuidora D. cerveza. Su negocio lo empezó poco a poco y lo ha hecho crecer D. forma increíble por su manera D. trabajar.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró productos lácteos que en ese tiempo vendía, pero se percató que mucho más se ganaba en la venta D. bebidas y cambio D. rubro.
Con este crédito D. 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en el negocio D. bebidas, pues la venta es superior en Navidad.
Martha sueña con la permanente estabilidad D. su familia, con la unión D. ella su esposo y la hermosa familia que su hijo ha formado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Felicita R. D. B. is 45 and is president of The Entrepreneurs Community Bank II. She lives on La Marina Avenue in the maritime port city of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo which is in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied Technical Administration and married at the age of 21. She had a daughter and a son. Her daughter died, a tragedy she has been able to overcome thanks to her enterprising spirit. Her business is selling drinks from her house. She is also a beer distributor. She began the business little by little and has maD. it grow beyond belief because of her work habits. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she bought milk products which she was reselling in that period, but she realized that more could be earned selling beverages and changed direction. With this loan of 800 soles, to be repaid in six installments, she will invest in her beverage business, since sales are higher, especially around the Christmas season. Martha dreams of the continuing stability of her family together with her husband and the beautiful family that her son has formed.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the business of selling beverages including during the Christmas season festivities

loans.name: Willie Wilson

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el caballero Willie Wilson U. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa y cosméticos ofrecida en su propio tramo donde atiende a sus clientes todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

La razón por la cual su negocio se ha venido desarrollando grandemente es gracias a Ceprodel ya que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de la mercadería. La razón por la cual hoy en día una vez mas espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito ya que requiere comprar la ropa y los cosméticos de sus proveedores y le urge obtener esta mercadería para ofertarla de inmediato en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya, Mr. Willie Wilson U. sells clothing and cosmetics in his own business space, where he serves his customers everyday from early in the morning until dusk.

His business has been developing greatly thanks to Ceprodel, which has given him loans that he has used to purchase merchandise. The reason why he once again hopes to have a loan from Ceprodel is that he needs to purchase clothing and cosmetics from his suppliers. He urgently needs to obtain this merchandise in order to offer it immediately at his store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en la ciudad de Itá, está casado con la señora María Gómez, tienen un solo hijo en edad escolar.

Comenta que trabajó mucho tiempo como empleado del taller mecánico de un familiar, gracias a  los ahorros que realizaba y al apoyo económicos de sus padres consiguió comprar herramientas varias y montar su propio taller en su domicilio desde hace 6 años, hoy día tiene una clientela conformada por taxistas, repartidores de panificados y particulares a cuyos vehículos realiza mantenimientos, reparación o cambio de repuestos.

Precisa de un préstamo para la construcción de un tinglado en su taller, a modo de que en los días de lluvia o intenso calor pueda brindarles a sus clientes y a si mismo mayor comodidad y atención ya que gracias a los buenos trabajos que realiza van aumentando cada vez más su cantidad de clientes
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of Itá. He is married with María Gómez and they have a school-aged son. He says that we worked for a long time as an employee in a family member's mechanic shop. Thanks to his savings and his parents' financial help he was able to buy various tools and open his own shop in his home six years ago. Today, he has customers who are taxi drivers, bread delivery people and members of the public whose vehicles need maintenance, fixing or spare parts changed. He explains that he needs this loan to build a platform in his shop so that when it rains or is very hot he can give his clients and himself greater comfort and better service as thanks to his good work he is getting new customers daily.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a platform

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es: Ana Fabiola B. S. tiene 26 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ana no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Ana es la compra ropa y cosméticos. En la actualidad la actividad de la Joven Ana Fabiola la ofrece en su tienda situada en su casa de habitación la que dirige con el apoyo de su Señora Madre, también participa en el taller de costura de su Mama es ahí que nace su interés por ser comerciante hace mas de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos de Ana son de obtener muy buenos ingresos ya que esta interesada en complacer a sus clientes por lo que así  obtendría fama. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos y calzado. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ana Fabiola B. S. is 26 years old and single; she does not have any children. Ana sells clothing and cosmetics. Young Ana Fabiola currently has a store in her home from which she sells with her mother's help. She in turn helps her mother in her dressmaking business, which is how she became interested in becoming a businesswoman 11 years ago, at which time she started her own business. Ana's goals are to make a good income as she cares very much about satisfying her customers as it is they who will make her reputation. The loan is for working capital to buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear. She is asking for C$20,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es: Ursula tiene 34 años, vive alquilada en la casa de uno de sus familiares, junto a su esposo y a sus 4 hijos; Milagros de 17, Luis de 14, Kevin de 10 y Antonela de 1 año y 4 meses, a quienes desea darles una buena vida. Para Ursula alquilar vestidos es una distracción más que un trabajo, desde que era niña siempre le gustó probarse la ropa de sus hermanas y ver cuáles combinaban mejor. Actualmente tiene un stand en una céntrica galería de la ciudad de Puno, en la cual atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y felicidad. Lleva ya 4 años realizando este negocio y disfruta mucho de hacerlo, ya que le gusta aconsejar a sus clientes sobre qué vestido les quedará mejor. Ursula desea en el futuro tener una tienda muy grande, donde no solo alquile vestidos, sino que también pueda vender ropa juvenil, lo más difícil de su trabajo es cuidar y mantener los vestidos, puesto que estos siempre tienen que estar bonitos y nuevos, para que sean alquilados con mayor facilidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por las demás socias, ya que es muy activa y solidaria. Ursula invertirá los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita en comprar más vestidos, para implementar mejor su stand y tener una mayor variedad para mostrar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ursula is 34 years old. She rents from a relative with her husband and 4 children, Milagros (17), Luis (14), Kevin (10) and Antonela (16 months). She hopes to give them a good life. For Ursula, renting out dresses is more an enjoyable pastime than a job; since she was young she always enjoyed trying out and matching her sisters' clothing. She has a stand in a shopping gallery in the center of the city of Puno, in which she kindly and happily serves her customers. She has spent four years in this business and enjoys it very much, since she likes advising her customers which dress looks best on them. She hopes to own a large store in the future in which she would not only rent dresses but also sell children's clothing. The hardest part of her work is caring for the dresses, as they must always be pretty and new so that they are easy to rent. This is her second loan with MFP; she has always been timely with her payments and will be so now. She is well-loved at her local bank by the other members since she is very active and supportive. She will use the 1500 new soles for more dresses in order to improve her stand and provide more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new dresses to rent to customers

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Mrs. Nura P., 35, is a tailor in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. Tailoring is their traditional work. Both Mrs. P. and her husband, Surendra P., make different types of dresses for both ladies and gentlemen.

Mrs. P. plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use her income for self improvement and for her children's education. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing and Mrs. P. is saving her income to provide a good education for her children.

She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her son is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary is a 22 year-old single man living in Gharifeh, Mount Lebanon. He has been a taxi driver for the past three years, when he first received his driver's license. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,200 to fix mechanical issues in his taxi.

loans.use: To fix mechanical issues in his taxi

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is currently involved in selling vegetables. She goes from house-to-house in their village to sell her produce. She has found that vending house-to-house is much more effective than just displaying her produce in an improvised vending stall in front of their house. 
Teresita is 53 years old and married to Juanito P. who is 57 years old. They reside in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela, and they have been blessed with five children. Their first child, Lorely, is 34 years old; Arnel is 32 years old; Gerlie is 30 years old; Madeline is 26 years old and Arjay is 13 years old. Teresita hopes that her business grows so that she can pay for her youngest child’s education.
She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 for the improvement of her business. She will utilize the loan as additional working capital and it will enabling her to purchase different kinds of vegetables.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Doté Ata Sé

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé en 2006 le commerce de chemises, il a associé plus tard à cette activité la vente de cartes de recharges. Il veut attirer plus de clients, par l’achat de nouveaux modèles de chemises, c’est pour cette raison qu’il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son second crédit afin d’acheter des chemises et 2 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCELL.
texts.en:
Being single and having to provide for himself, this gentleman started a business selling shirts in 2006 and later added rechargeable cell phone cards to his sales activity. Wanting to attract more customers by selling the latest shirt styles, he has approached WAGES for what will be his second loan, so that he can buy shirts and two boxes of rechargeable Togocell cards.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and rechargeable phonecards

loans.name: Ata

texts.en: Ata S. M., 60, is married with 6 children.  She has  years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public  4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Ata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, ranging pole

loans.name: German

texts.es: German es un pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado a la produccion de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, las que actualmente vende en granza y a bajos precios, con la participacion del solicitante en la construccion de un trillo arrocero estaria logrando asociarse a este y ademas poder procesar el producto final y vender a mejores precios que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar y asi lograr que sus 2 hijos continuen sus estudios de primaria que cursan en la escuela de la comunidad.
texts.en:
German is a farmer dedicated to producing rice in small quantities, which he sells in their husks and therefore at lower prices. This loan solicitor is hoping to participate in the construction of a rice threshing machine. This would allow him to use the machine, process his rice to the final product stage, and therefore sell it at better prices. This would also permit him to improve his family’s standard of living, and his 2 children to continue with their primary school studies at the local school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution toward building a rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Pulot

texts.ru: Пулот успешно закончил первый займ в МЗФ Микроинвесте. Он занимается откормом скота. У Пулота есть большой участок земли где растет корм для скота. Он планирует купить баранов откормить их и продать перед святым праздником «Курбан» (Курбан - это святой праздник где приносят жертвоприношения овец).
texts.en:
Pulot successfully repaid his first loan with MLF MicroInvest. He is involved in raising livestock. Pulot has a large plot of land where livestock feed grows. He plans to purchase rams, raise and sell them prior to the sacred holiday of Kurban (Kurban is a sacred holiday for which sheep is sacrificed).

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María vive con su esposo Manuel Enrique al igual que con sus 2 hijos, ellos son una familia muy unida que se apoya para cada proyecto, ellos tienen un ingreso de un estudio fotográfico del cual Don Manuel es propietario, por su parte la señora María es propietaria de un restaurantito donde también realiza la venta de miscelánea en una colonia de la ciudad, negocio que tienen establecido desde hace 4 años, su proyecto es compra de mercancía para inversión al restaurantito de nombre “Miscelánea Manuel” para cumplir con los antojitos de su clientela, por tal motivo están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María lives with her husband Manuel Enrique and their 2 children. They are a very close family who supports each other with their businesses. They generate income from a photography studio owned by Don Manuel. Sra. María operates a small restaurant where she also sells miscellaneous items she acquires from other parts of the city. She has been in business for 4 years and needs to acquire inventory for her establishment called “Miscelánea Manuel” so that she can prepare snack foods for her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng P., 26, is a silk weaver. In the past, she used to be a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Un, 38, sells recycling materials. They just have a young son and live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

The couple has built a proper house to live because their old house broke down in some parts. But, they purchased construction materials (cement, sandstone, bricks…) on credit so Sreng is requesting her first loan of 200 USD to pay for construction materials costs.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials cost for building her house.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kheng K. lives in Thlork village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nou Sokha, is a motorbike taxi driver. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Kheng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Jovia's Group

texts.en:
Jovia T. originally started her business brewing beer for the local population. Her success in this enterprise allowed her to raise enough capital to buy two goats. For the past four years, Jovia has exclusively dealt in the goat trade. She is 57 years old and the leader of her group in Bushenyi. She is married with five children who are all currently enrolled in school.

Jovia would like to use this loan to purchase more goats and increase her stock. Her eventual business goal is to, one day, shift into the cattle trade, which is more capital intensive but has the potential for higher profits. Endowed with great determination, Jovia is certain that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: This young man is single. He lives in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1987. Khalid has been in the sheep breeding business for two years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy 15 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Akumu

texts.en:
Akumu J. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials such as baking flour and cooking oil.  Akumu is 27 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a resturant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking materials such as baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: F. Clarisse est née en 1971 et est mariée à AMOUSSOUGA Cosme, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, et un autre enfant à charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Clarisse vit à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin, depuis 10 ans. C’est avec ses enfants et son mari que Clarisse vit. Clarisse a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Clarisse vend des divers (pâtes dentifrices, savons, papiers hygiéniques, piles, bougies, sachets, lait, tomates en boîtes, riz, huile végétale, etc.) au marché d’Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Clarisse s’approvisionne. Clarisse est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’accroître son activité et d’augmenter davantage son chiffre d’affaire, Clarisse sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
F. Clarisse was born on 1971 and is married to AMOUSSOUGA Cosme, a merchant. The couple has three children plus another child to support. Some of them are in school. Clarisse has been living in Dogoudo, in Allada (Atlantique county, in Benin) for ten years. She lives with her children and husband. Clarisse has attended primary school only. For twelve years, she has been selling a variety of goods (toothpaste, soaps, toilet paper, batteries, candles, baggies, milk, canned tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil, etc.) at the Allada market. She stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already had two ALIDé loans, which were repaid. With the aim of growing her business and increasing her sales, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (boxes of soap and canned foods, sacks of rice)

loans.name: Teodocio Hugo

texts.es:
Teodocio vive en la zona Vino Tinto en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive  en un pequeño departamento el cual está en alquiler, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como auxiliar en una imprenta en el centro de la ciudad. Tiene dos pequeños los cuales están en edad escolar y mientras ambos padres trabajan quedan bajo el cuidado de su abuela.
 
Se dedica al auto-transporte, trabaja como chofer propietario de minibús en líneas  céntricas de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de partes del motor y realizar otras reparaciones a su movilidad.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Teodocio lives in the Vino Tinto zone of the city, La Paz. He lives in a small apartment, which is rented, with his wife, who works as an assistant in a printing press in the city center. He has two little ones who are school age, and while both parents work, they are taken care of by their grandmother. He makes his living in auto-transportation; he works as an owner-driver of a minibus on the city's central lines. He will set aside the loan to buy motor parts and to make other repairs to his mobility. This is the second loan with Impro; the evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicular repairs

loans.name: Biveki Peti

texts.es:
Biveki García Z. es una señora de 40 años, tiene 5 hijos de 19, 18, 15, 11, 6, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegios particulares y dos en escuelas fiscales. Ella vive un sector urbano marginal al norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil, vecindario que no cuenta con ningún tipo de servicio básico tales como: agua, alcantarillado y caminos pavimentados. 
Hace dos años empezó a trabajar recolectando todo tipo de plásticos tales como botellas, fundas, vasos y cartones, pues cerca del sector donde vive existen muchas fábricas que botan estos tipos de materiales reciclables.   
Doña Biveki realiza está actividad porque su horario es en la tarde de 14h00 a 19h00 y le permite dedicarle más tiempo a sus hijos durante la mañana. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer su casa.
Sus sueños son poder terminar de construir su casa para que su familia se sienta más cómoda y tener un negocio propio para no tener que andar en las calles poniendo en riesgo su vida.
texts.en:
Biveki García Z. is a 40 year old woman. She has 5 children who are 19, 18, 15, 11 and 6 years old. Two of her children study in private schools and two in public schools. She lives in a marginal, urban area north of Guayaquil in a neighborhood that does not have any basic services such as water, a sewer system or paved roads. Two years ago she started a job collecting all types of plastic, such as bottles, packaging, glass and cardboard. There are a lot of factories near where she lives that throw away these types of recyclable materials. Biveki does this work because the hours are in the afternoon, from 2pm to 7pm, and that allows her to devote more time to her children in the morning. With the loan she is going to purchase construction materials for her house. Her dreams are to be able to finish the construction on her house so that her family can be more comfortable and to have her own business so she no longer has to put her life in danger walking the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is a farmer who has been working the land for the past 11 years. There are six people in his family, including his wife and four children, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, a job in which he has formal training. Farming has helped him financially. As you can see in the photo, Naim also is engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. 

With the upcoming season arriving, he needs to grow potatoes and onions. This requires money, and he does not have enough. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to stock seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purhcase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina M. is a married woman.  She runs a shop selling a variety of goods at Buguruni Kisiwani in Dar es Salaam. Business goods sold include; soap, maize flower, maize, beans, cooking oil and rice. She purchases the business goods from the city market wholesale and retail shops. Georgina has been running the business for four years and the business income generated is used to meet her family's needs and  to capitalize her business. Georgina is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 TZS to buy more business goods and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 37 años, conformó una familia feliz con Ana, su esposa, y sus 2 hijos; Jean Carlos de 13 y Rosmery de 8 años.
Desde hace 8 años empezó a brindar el servicio de taxi y le va muy bien, pues todos los días trabaja desde tempranas horas por las calles de la ciudad de Lima. Él menciona que acepta todas las dificultades que trae consigo su trabajo por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, a los cuales quiere ver profesionales en un futuro. Su esposa Ana es su principal apoyo y entre los dos laboran cada día por el progreso de su hogar, pues saben que ahora que están jóvenes deben poner todo de su parte para construirse un futuro mejor. 
En adelante quiere comprar otro carro para alquilarlo y obtener ingresos adicionales, y así, poco a poco, ir edificando un buen porvenir para su familia.

Roberto ya tiene experiencia con los créditos en MFP, este es su cuarto préstamo y en su grupo no tiene problemas, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará refaccionar su auto, el cual ya es propio.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old, and has a happy family that includes Ana, his wife, and their 2 children: Jean Carlos, 13; and Rosmery, 8. Eight years ago he started a business providing taxi services, and it is doing very well. Each day from very early in the morning he works in the streets of the city of Lima. He mentions that he accepts all of the difficulties that come with his job for the welfare of his small children, whom he would like to see become professionals in the future. His wife Ana is his main support and between the two of them they work every day to improve their economic well-being. They know that since they are young now they must do everything in their power to build a better future. In the future, he wants to buy another car that he could rent out to obtain increased earnings and gradually build a better future for his family. Roberto has experience with loans from MFP; this is his 4th loan and his group does not have any problems, since all of his fellow members are very punctual with their payments. With the money that he requests now he will refurbish his auto, which he owns.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his auto

loans.name: Julia Amanda

texts.es:
Esta cliente esta ubicada en la comunidad el espino y siempre se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria
y al desarrollo de su nivel de vida.
Este credito le ha servido porque con las ganancia ha logrado comprar ganado y tambien preparar las condiciones para el desarrollo del ganado.
texts.en:
This client lives in El Espino; she has always been a farmer and has raised animals to develop her standard of living. This loan has been of use because she has purchased pigs and has prepared the necessary conditions for the development of the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. is a 34-year-old member of ASHI. She is the mother of three whose ages range is from 4 to 13 years old. She has a loving and supportive husband and is inspired by her husband’s determination to change their standard of living. Thus, she wants to do her part in earning money on his behalf to support the needs of their children.

Just last year, Victoria joined ASHI and was able to receive a loan which was used to operate her own hog/pig-fattening business. When she sold the pigs after four months of raising, the profit she earned from this business was fair enough. With that she was able to make a step towards achieving her goal for her family.

Presently, Victoria is requesting from Kiva a much larger loan so as to be able to grow her business further. She hopes that her profit will grow and she will be able to have enough savings to purchase a fishing boat for her fisherman husband. At present, in order for him to go fishing, he borrows a fishing boat from their neighbor when it is not being used.

Despite the present economic situation of her family which is very poor, Victoria is still optimistic that someday, through her business, their way of life will be changed and all of their children will graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Marvie's Group

texts.en:
Marvie A. is from the village of Tueg, Bitag Grande, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Marvie is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marvie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marvie owns & operates a business making and selling kitchen supplies & products to tourists and local community members. Marvie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Marvie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. Marvie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marvie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sorbeh Kargbo Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Sorbeh K.”, after the surname of the group’s leader. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods ito their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. Thus, they are requesting a loan of SLL 2,100,000 in order to further strengthen their businesses. 

Their leader, 40-year-old Alie K. (pictured in the left), sells rice, groundnuts/peanuts, drinks and water at wholesale. He was born in Koya, about 38 miles from Waterloo. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children.  Alie K. has been a businessman since his childhood days. With his share of the loan (SLL 500,000), he will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnuts/peanuts, drinks and water

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang T. is 56 years old and she lives in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phorn Phoung, are farmers who own 3.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Lang T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase a plowing machine to support her farm crop. Mrs. Lang T. is a mother of four children; one is a farm laborer and the other three are farmers and also help on their parent's farm. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase a plowing machine

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia D. is from Bliss Village. She is 44 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Cynthia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cynthia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Cynthia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cynthia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the village of Mauswagon. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling corn from her own farm. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for the corn. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Emma from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the corn

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en:
Halimatu Y. is married but has no children yet. She has no educational background. Halimatu moves around Abura selling jewelry and cosmetics. Her husband is a driver. 

Halimatu wishes to add the loan she hopes to receive to her initial capital to purchase more jewelry for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Halimatu plans to save to buy a shop to sell in.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to purchase more jewelry for sale

loans.name: Andres Vicente

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio una tienda lo cual percibe un ingreso semanal de S/. 300.00. el destino del credito es para compra de mercaderia y tener una tienda mas surtida
texts.en:
The borrower is a single man who runs a small shop in his home. His income from this business is 300 Soles per week (a little over US$100). The loan will be used to buy merchandise, so his shop is better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a 40-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband in Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Ana over the past few months describes her as a humble, gentle woman who aspires to move up in the world.

In order to contribute to her family’s income, Ana has a business selling various products including bags, clothing and sandals. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of such products which Ana will sell to members of her community.

Ana sells her products from her house. When she makes sales on credits, her sons help her to collect on what is owed to her. One of her sons contributes to the family income and Ana also takes care of a child from the community in order to earn extra money.

For business advice, Ana consults her husband and sons, although she must execute all the daily tasks associated with her business on her own (her children are usually studying).

Ana would like very much to one day own a small restaurant or “soda” as they say in Costa Rica. She feels that such an enterprise would allow her to better provide for her children. She hopes to send as many of them as possible to university. In the meantime, Ana says business is going well and she hasn’t had any problems yet.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell
